sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 requires our Directors, executive officers, and greater-than-10% Shareowners to file reports with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEC regulations require us to identify anyone who filed a required report late during the most recent fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our review of these reports and written certifications provided to us, we believe that the filing requirements for all of these reporting persons were complied with during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board-Adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We operate under corporate governance principles and practices (the Corporate Governance Guidelines") that are designed to maximize long-term Shareowner value, align the interests of the Board and management with those of our Shareowners and promote high ethical conduct among our Directors and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the Directors, and all of the members of the Audit Committee, Compensation and Talent Management Committee ("C&T Committee"), and Nominating and Governance Committee, are required to meet the independence requirements of the New York Stock Exchange and the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the Directors is designated a Lead Director, who chairs and may call executive session meetings of the independent, non-employee Directors, approves proposed meeting agendas and schedules, and establishes a method for Shareowners and other interested parties to communicate with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews CEO succession planning at least once per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and each Board committee have the power to hire independent legal, financial or other advisors as they may deem necessary, at our expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that non-employee Directors meet in executive session at least three times annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a general practice, the non-employee Directors meet in executive session at each Board meeting, and did so in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and Board committees conduct annual performance evaluations to assess whether the Board, its committees, and the Directors are functioning effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent members of the Board use the recommendations from the Nominating and Governance Committee and C&T Committee to conduct an annual review of the CEOs performance and determine the CEOs compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee Directors who change their principal responsibility or occupation from that held when they were elected shall offer his or her resignation for the Board to consider the continued appropriateness of Board membership under the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have access to Kellogg officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuing education is provided to Directors consistent with our Board education policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Director may be nominated for a new term if he or she would be seventy-two or older at the time of election, unless the Board determines that it is in the best interest of Kellogg to re-nominate the independent Director for additional terms due to his or her unique capabilities or special circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Director shall serve as a director, officer or employee of a competitor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Director should serve on more than four other boards of public companies in addition to Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Directors are expected to comply with stock ownership guidelines for Directors, under which they are generally expected to hold at least five times their annual cash retainer in stock and stock equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure; Communication with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following section describes Kelloggs Board leadership ructure, the reasons why the structure is in place at this time, the roles of various positions, and related key governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is composed of eleven independent Directors, and Mr. Bryant, our current Chairman of the Board and CEO, and Mr. Jenness (who was our Executive Chairman until June 2014).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of our independent directors, Mr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rebolledo, will be retiring at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board had six standing Committees:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Audit,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) C&T,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Nominating and Governance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) Manufacturing,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) Social Responsibility and Public Policy, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit, C&T, and Nominating and Governance committees are composed solely of independent Directors, each with a different independent Director serving as committee chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the mix of experienced independent and management Directors that make up our Board, along with the independent role of our Lead Director and our independent Board Committee composition, benefits Kellogg and its Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that it is beneficial to Kellogg and its Shareowners to designate one of the Directors as a Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director serves a variety of roles, including reviewing and approving Board agendas, meeting materials and schedules to confirm the appropriate Board and committee topics are reviewed and sufficient time is allocated to each; serving as liaison between the Chairman and CEO and non-management Directors (however, each Director has direct and regular access to the Chairman and CEO); presiding at the executive sessions of independent Directors and at all other meetings of the Board of Directors at which the Chairman of the Board is not present; calling an executive session of independent Directors at any time, consistent with the Corporate Governance Guidelines; and coordinating succession planning for the Board, including by having the Nominating and Governance Committee and the independent Directors regularly discuss and evaluate CEO succession plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Don Knauss, an independent Director and the Chairman of the Nominating and Governance Committee, is currently our Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Knauss is an effective Lead Director for Kellogg due to, among other things, his independence, his board leadership experience as CEO, Chairman and Executive Chairman of The Clorox Company, strong strategic and financial acumen, commitment to ethics, extensive knowledge of the retail environment and branded consumer products, and deep understanding of Kellogg and its business obtained while serving as a Kellogg Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Knauss may be contacted at donald.knauss@kellogg.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any communications which Shareowners or interested parties may wish to send to the Board may be directly sent to Mr. Knauss at this e-mail address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly reviews the Company's strategy, including reviews of key components of the strategy throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also regularly communicates with its Shareowners through its Shareowner outreach program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A regular topic in those discussions is Company strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner insights are provided to the full Board and its Committees as part of its decision-making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the roles of Chairman and CEO, the Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that the roles may be separated or combined, and the Board exercises its discretion in combining or separating these positions as it deems appropriate in light of prevailing circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bryant became CEO in January 2011 and for the first three years of his tenure as CEO, the roles of Chairman and CEO were separate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On July 1, 2014, the Chairman and CEO roles were combined, with the Board electing Mr. Bryant as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the combined roles of Chairman and CEO, together with the separate role of our Lead Director, is currently the most effective leadership structure for Kellogg for many reasons, including Mr. Bryants extensive knowledge of our business, operations, and risks acquired in his various roles at Kellogg including as CEO, which gives him the insight necessary to combine the responsibilities of strategic development along with management of day-to-day operations and execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As stated in the Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Board believes that the combination or separation of these offices should continue to be considered as part of the succession planning process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board conducts an annual performance evaluation to determine whether the Board, its committees, and the Directors are functioning effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board evaluation occurs during the first half of each year, between February and April.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, focus areas identified through the evaluation are incorporated into the Board's agenda for the balance of the year to monitor its progress.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee also conducts its own annual self-evaluation to assess the functioning of the committee and the effectiveness of the committee members, including the committee chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the annual Board self-evaluation, the Board evaluates whether the current leadership structure continues to be appropriate for Kellogg and its Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide the flexibility for our Board to modify ou leadership structure in the future as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that Kellogg, like many U.S. companies, has been well-served by this flexible leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Enterprise Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board utilizes our Enterprise Risk Management ("ERM") process to assist in fulfilling its oversight of our risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management, who is responsible for day-to-day risk management, conducts a formal risk assessment of Kelloggs business annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The risk assessment process is global in nature and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has been developed to identify and assess Kelloggs current and emerging risks, including the nature of the risk, as well as to identify steps to mitigate and manage the controllable aspects of each risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several hundred of our key business leaders, functional heads and other managers are surveyed and/or interviewed to develop this information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While risk oversight is a full Board responsibility, the responsibility for monitoring the ERM process has been delegated to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, one of the leaders of the ERM process is the Vice President, Internal Audit, who reports to the Chair of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the full Board at each of their regularly scheduled meetings receive an update on the key enterprise risks, including current status and action items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the risk assessment are reviewed with the Audit Committee and the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The centerpiece of the assessment is the discussion of key risks which includes the potential magnitude and likelihood of each risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the process for assessing each risk, management identifies the nature of the risk, the senior executive responsible for managing the risk, the potential impact of the risk, managements initiatives to manage the risk, the most recent Board or Committee update, and the timing of the next scheduled Board or Committee review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the risk assessment are then integrated into the Boards processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight responsibility for each risk is allocated among the full Board and its Committees, and specific Board and Committee agendas are developed accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Committee chair works directly with Kelloggs key senior executive responsible for the matters allocated to the Committee to develop agenda topics, review materials to be discussed with the Committee, and otherwise discuss those topics relating to the particular Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through this process, each key risk is reviewed at least annually, with many topics reviewed on several occasions throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the dynamic nature of risk and the business environment generally, at every Audit Committee meeting, the Company provides a status report on all key enterprise risks, and regularly provides a more in depth report on select topics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, adjustments are made to Board and Committee agendas throughout the year so that enterprise risks are reviewed at the relevant times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process facilitates the Boards ability to fulfill its oversight responsibilities of Kelloggs risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting for Directors; Director Resignation Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In an uncontested election of Directors (that is, an election where the number of nominees is equal to the number of seats open) any nominee for Director who receives a greater number of votes withheld from his or her election than votes for such election shall promptly tender his or her resignation to the Nominating and Governance Committee (following certification of the Shareowner vote) for consideration in accordance with the following procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee would promptly consider such resignation and recommend to the Qualified Independent Directors (as defined below) the action to be taken with respect to such offered resignation, which may include: (1) accepting the resignation; (2) maintaining the Director but addressing what the Qualified Independent Directors believe to be the underlying cause of the withheld votes; (3) determining that the Director will not be renominated in the future for election; or (4) rejecting the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee would consider all relevant factors including, without limitation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the stated reasons why votes were withheld from such Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) any alternatives for curing the underlying cause of the withheld votes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the tenure and qualifications of the Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the Directors past and expected future contributions to Kellogg;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) our Director criteria;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) our Corporate Governance Guidelines; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) the overall composition of the Board, including whether accepting the resignation would cause Kellogg to fail to meet any applicable SEC or NYSE requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Qualified Independent Directors would act on the Nominating and Governance Committees recommendation no later than 90 days following the date of the Shareowners meeting where the election occurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering the Nominating and Governance Committees recommendation, the Qualified Independent Directors would consider the factors considered by the Nominating and Governance Committee and such additional information and factors the Board believes to be relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the Qualified Independent Directors decision, Kellogg would promptly disclose in a current report on Form 8-K the decision whether to accept the resignation as tendered (providing a full explanation of the process by which the decision was reached or, if applicable, the reasons for rejecting the tendered resignation).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that a resignation is accepted, the Nominating and Governance Committee would recommend to the Board whether to fill such vacancy or vacancies or to reduce the size of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Director who tenders his or her resignation pursuant to this provision would not participate in the Nominating and Governance Committees recommendation or Qualified Independent Directors consideration regarding whether to accept the tendered resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to voting, the Qualified Independent Directors would afford the Director an opportunity to provide any information or statement that he or she deems relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a majority of the members of the Nominating and Governance Committee received a greater number of votes withheld from their election than votes for their election at the same election, then the remaining Qualified Independent Directors who are on the Board who did not receive a greater number of votes withheld from their election than votes for their election (or who were not standing for election) would consider the matter directly or may appoint a Board committee amongst themselves solely for the purpose of considering the tendered resignations that would make the recommendation to the Board whether to accept or reject them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this policy, the term Qualified Independent Directors means:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Directors who (1) are independent Directors (as defined in accordance with the NYSE Corporate Governance Rules) and (2) are not required to offer their resignation in accordance with this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there are fewer than three independent Directors then serving on the Board who are not required to offer their resignations in accordance with this policy, then the Qualified Independent Directors shall mean all of the independent Directors and each independent Director who is required to offer his or her resignation in accordance with this Policy shall recuse himself or herself from the deliberations and voting only with respect to his or her individual offer to resign.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all current Directors (other than Mr. Bryant and Mr. Jenness) are independent based on the following standards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) no entity (other than a charitable entity) of which such a Director is an employee in any position or any immediate family member (as defined) is an executive officer, made payments to, or received payments from, Kellogg and its subsidiaries in any of the 2016, 2015, or 2014 fiscal years in excess of the greater of (1) $1,000,000 or (2) two percent of that entitys annual consolidated gross revenues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) no such Director, or any immediate family member employed as an executive officer of Kellogg or its subsidiaries, received in any twelve month period within the last three years more than $120,000 per year in direct compensation from Kellogg or its subsidiaries, other than Director and committee fees and pension or other forms of deferred compensation for prior service not contingent in any way on continued service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) Kellogg did not employ such Director in any position, or any immediate family member as an executive officer, during the past three years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) no such Director was a current partner or employee of a firm that is Kelloggs internal or external auditor (Auditor), no immediate family member of such Director was a current partner of the Auditor or an employee of the Auditor who personally worked on our audit, and no Director or immediate family member of such Director was during the past three years a partner or employee of the Auditor and personally worked on our audit within that time;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) no such Director or immediate family member served as an executive officer of another company during the past three years at the same time as a current executive officer of Kellogg served on the compensation committee of such company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) no other material relationship exists between any such Director and Kellogg or our subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considers from time to time commercial ordinary-course transactions as it assesses independence status, including transactions relating to selling product and marketing arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has concluded that these transactions did not impair Director independence for a variety of reasons including that the amounts in question were considerably under the thresholds set forth in our independence standards and the relationships were not deemed material.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Recommendations for Director Nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee will consider Shareowner nominations for membership on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, nominations may be submitted to the Office of the Secretary, Kellogg Company, One Kellogg Square, Battle Creek, Michigan 49017, which will forward them to the Chairman of the Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations must be in writing and we must receive the recommendation not earlier than November 8, 2017 and not later than December 8, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations must also include certain other requirements specified in our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When filling a vacancy on the Board, the Nominating and Governance Committee identifies the desired skills and experience of a new Director and nominates individuals who it believes can strengthen the Boards capabilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and further diversify the collective experience represented by the then-current Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee may, as it has done in the past, engage third parties to assist in the search and provide recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, Directors are generally asked to recommend candidates for the position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The candidates would be evaluated based on the process outlined in the Corporate Governance Guidelines and the Nominating and Governance Committee charter, and the same process would be used for all candidates, including candidates recommended by Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Nomination of Director Candidates for Inclusion in Proxy Statement for Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, our Board amended our bylaws to implement proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As amended, our bylaws permit a Shareowner, or a group of up to 20 Shareowners, owning 3% or more of the Companys outstanding common stock continuously for at least three years to nominate and include in our proxy materials director candidates constituting up to the greater of two individuals or 20% of the Board, provided that the Shareowner(s) and the nominee(s) satisfy the requirements specified in the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, nominations may be submitted to the Office of the Secretary, Kellogg Company, One Kellogg Square, Battle Creek, Michigan 49017- 3534.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such nomination must be received by us not earlier than October 11, 2017 and not later than November 10, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such nomination must meet the other requirements set forth in our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at Annual Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All incumbent Directors are expected to attend the Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our then incumbent Directors attended the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Conduct/Ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted the Code of Conduct for Kellogg Company Directors and Global Code of Ethics for Kellogg Company employees (including the CEO, CFO, other named executive officers, and corporate controller).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any amendments to or waivers of the Global Code of Ethics applicable to our CEO, CFO or corporate controller will be posted on www.kelloggcompany.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no amendments to or waivers of the Global Code of Ethics in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Availability of Corporate Governance Documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of the Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Charters of the Audit, C&T, and Nominating and Governance Committees of the Board, the Code of Conduct for Kellogg Company Directors, and Global Code of Ethics for Kellogg Company employees can be found on the Kellogg Company website at www.kelloggcompany.com under Investor Relations, then Corporate Governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners may also request a free copy of these documents from: Kellogg Company Consumer Affairs, P.O. Box CAMB, Battle Creek, Michigan 49016 (phone: (800) 962-1413), the Investor Relations Department at that same address (phone: (269) 961-2800) or investor.relations@kellogg.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD AND COMMITTEE MEMBERSHIP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board routinely reviews Board composition to ensure that it has the right balance of skills to fulfill its oversight obligations for Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of that process, the Nominating and Governance Committee and the Board consider current tenure and potential retirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last several years our Board has been refreshing naturally, including six new Directors since the beginning of 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board had the following standing committees in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Audit;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) C&T;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Nominating and Governance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) Manufacturing;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) Social Responsibility and Public Policy; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) Executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board held seven meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the incumbent Directors attended at least 75% of the total number of meetings of the Board and of all Board committees of which the Directors were members during 2016 that were held while such Directors were on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below provides 2016 membership and meeting information for each Board committee as of December 31, 2016 (last day of fiscal year):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name(3)   Audit   Compensation and Talent Management   Nominating and Governance    Manufacturing   Social Responsibility and Public Policy  Executive John Bryant(1)                  Chair Stephanie A. Burns                   John Dillon      Chair             Richard Dreiling(2)                   Zachary Gund            Chair       Jim Jenness                   Don Knauss         Chair          Mary Laschinger                   Cynthia Milligan               Chair    La June Montgomery Tabron                   Rogelio Rebolledo   Chair                Carolyn M. Tastad                   Noel R. Wallace                   2016 Meetings Held   5   5   3   3   3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Mr. Bryant is not a formal member of any committee (other than Executive) and attends meetings for each committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Mr. Dreiling was elected as Director, and his initial term commenced, on June 13, 201
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Mr. Gordon Gund and Ms. McLaughlin Korologos retired from the Board during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, they are not included in the table above because they were not members of the Board as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Mr. Gordon Gund served on the C&T, Nominating and Governance, and Executive Committees and Ms. McLaughlin Korologos served on the C&T, Nominating and Governance, Social Responsibility and Public Policy, and Executive Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a written charter, the Audit Committee, among other things, assists the Board in monitoring the integrity of our financial statements, the independence and performance of our independent registered public accounting firm, the performance of our internal audit function, our ERM process, our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, and other related matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee, or its Chair, also pre-approves all audit, internal control-related and permitted non-audit engagements and services by the independent registered public accounting firm and their affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also discusses and/or reviews specified matters with, and receives specified information or assurances from, Kellogg management and the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee also has the sole authority to appoint, subject to Shareowner ratification, or replace the independent registered public accounting firm, which directly reports to the Audit Committee, and is directly responsible for the compensation and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Rebolledo, the Chair of the Audit Committee, has been determined by the Board to be an audit committee financial expert, as that term is defined in Item 407(d)(5) of SEC Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Committee members meets the independence requirements of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and Talent Management Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a written charter, the C&T Committee, among other things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) reviews and approves the compensation philosophy and principles for senior executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) reviews and makes recommendations for the compensation of senior management personnel and monitors overall compensation for senior executives, including reviewing risks arising from Kelloggs compensation policies and practices;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) reviews and recommends the compensation of the CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) reviews talent development;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) has sole authority to retain or terminate any compensation consultant or other advisor used to evaluate senior executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) oversees and administers employee benefit plans to the extent provided in those plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) reviews with management employment and employment-related matters, including diversity and inclusion, and employment programs; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) reviews trends in management compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may form and delegate authority to subcommittees or the Chair when appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee, or its Chair, also approves all engagements and services to be performed by any consultants or advisors to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist the Committee in discharging its responsibilities, the Committee has retained an independent compensation consultant  Frederic W. Cook (Cook & Co.).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultant reports directly to the C&T Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to retaining any such consultant, or other advisor, the Committee must consider whether the work of such consultant or other advisor would raise a conflict of interest according to the independence factors enumerated by the New York Stock Exchange, as well as any other factors the Committee determines to be relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the work it performs for the C&T Committee and the Board, Cook & Co. does not provide any consulting services to Kellogg or its executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about the independence of the Committees consultant, refer to Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Compensation Approach  Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each member of the C&T Committee meets the definition of independence under our Corporate Governance Guidelines and the requirements of the New York Stock Exchange and further qualifies as a non-employee Director for purposes of Rule 16b-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Committee are not current or former employees of Kellogg, are not eligible to participate in any of our executive compensation programs, do not receive compensation that would impair their ability to make independent judgments about executive compensation, and are not affiliates of the Company, as defined under Rule 10c-1 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the composition of the Committee is designed to meet the tax deductibility criteria included in Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee is charged with overseeing the review and assessment of risks arising from Kelloggs compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes the Committee's annual review of our compensation program for design features considered to encourage excessive risk taking and Kelloggs approach to those features.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its review, the Committee also assesses perspectives from independent experts and regulators.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kellogg uses a number of approaches to mitigate excessive risk taking, including significant weighting towards long-term incentive compensation, emphasizing qualitative goals in addition to a variety of quantitative metrics, and equity ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this review, together with input from the independent compensation consultant, the C&T Committee determined that the risks arising from Kelloggs compensation policies and practices for our employees are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about the C&T Committees processes for establishing and overseeing executive compensation, refer to Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Compensation Approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Manufacturing Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a written charter, the Manufacturing Committee, among other things, assists the Board in discharging its oversight responsibilities with respect to topics relating to Kelloggs manufacturing and supply chain practices, with the primary focus on Kelloggs food quality and safety, manufacturing facility operations, people and labor strategies, and capital projects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As it deems appropriate, the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee reviews policies, programs and practices, and provides strategic advice and counsel concerning the matters set forth above including, but not limited to, food safety, employee health and safety, capacity utilization and planning, contingency planning, productivity programs, commodity purchasing and hedging programs, people utilization and people and labor strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a written charter, the Nominating and Governance Committee, among other things, assists the Board by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) identifying and reviewing the qualifications of candidates for Director and in determining the criteria for new Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) recommending nominees for Director to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) recommending committee assignments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) reviewing annually the Boards compliance with the Corporate Governance Guidelines;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) reviewing annually the Corporate Governance Guidelines and recommends changes to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (f) monitoring the performance of Directors and conducting performance evaluations of each Director before the Directors re-nomination to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (g) administering the annual evaluation of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (h) providing annually an evaluation of CEO performance used by the independent members of the Board in their annual review of CEO performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) considering and evaluating potential waivers of the Code of Conduct for Directors and Global Code of Ethics for senior officers (for which there were none in 2016);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (j) making a report to the Board on CEO succession planning at least annually;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (k) providing an annual review of the independence of Directors to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (l) reviewing and recommending to the Board responses to Shareowner proposals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (m) reviewing Director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair of the Nominating and Governance Committee, as Lead Director, also presides at executive sessions of independent Directors of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Nominating and Governance Committee members meets the independence requirements of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Social Responsibility and Public Policy Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a written charter, the Social Responsibility and Public Policy Committee, among other things, assists the Board in discharging its oversight responsibilities with respect to certain social and public policy issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews the Company's policies, programs and practices concerning public policy, government relations philanthropic activities/charitable contributions, sustainability and related topics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is particularly focused on the intersection of philanthropy, public policy, and sustainability and the Company's goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a written charter, the Executive Committee is generally empowered to act on behalf of the Board between meetings of the Board, with some exceptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more than 100 years, consumers have counted on Kellogg for great-tasting, high-quality and nutritious foods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kellogg is the worlds leading producer of cereal, second largest producer of cookies and crackers, and a leading producer of savory snacks and frozen foods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional product offerings include toaster pastries, cereal bars, fruit-flavored snacks and veggie foods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kellogg products are manufactured and marketed globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, we believe that in order for our Board to effectively guide Kellogg to long- term sustainable, dependable performance, it should be composed of individuals with sophistication and experience in the many disciplines that impact our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to best serve Kellogg and our Shareowners, we seek to have a Board, as a whole, that is competent in key corporate disciplines, including accounting and financial acumen, business judgment, crisis management, governance, leadership, people management, risk management, social responsibility and reputational issues, and strategy and strategic planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board must have specific knowledge related to Kelloggs industry, such as expertise in branded consumer products and consumer dynamics, health and nutrition, innovation / research and development, international markets, manufacturing and supply chain, marketing, regulatory and government affairs, the retail environment, and sales and distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee believes that all Directors must, at a minimum, meet the criteria set forth in the Boards Code of Conduct and the Corporate Governance Guidelines, which specify, among other things, that the Nominating and Governance Committee will consider criteria such as independence, diversity, age, skills and experience in the context of the needs of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addressing issues of diversity in particular, the Nominating and Governance Committee considers a nominees differences in viewpoint, professional experience, background, education, skill, age, race, gender and national origin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee believes that diversity of backgrounds and viewpoints is a key attribute for a director nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee seeks a diverse Board that is representative of our global business, Shareowners, consumers, customers, and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Nominating and Governance Committee carefully considers diversity when considering directors, it has not established a formal policy regarding diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee also will consider a combination of factors for each director, including whether the nominee (1) has the ability to represent all Shareowners without a conflict of interest; (2) has the ability to work in and promote a productive environment; (3) has sufficient time and willingness to fulfill the substantial duties and responsibilities of a Director; (4) has demonstrated the high level of character and integrity that we expect; (5) possesses the broad professional and leadership experience and skills necessary to effectively respond to the complex issues encountered by a multi- national, publicly-traded company; and (6) has the ability to apply sound and independent business judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee has determined that all of our Directors meet the criteria and qualifications set forth in the Boards Code of Conduct, the Corporate Governance Guidelines and the criteria set forth above for director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, each Director possesses the following critical personal qualities and attributes that we believe are essential for the proper functioning of the Board to allow it to fulfill its duties for our Shareowners: accountability, ethical leadership, governance, integrity, risk management, and sound business judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Directors have the mature confidence to assess and challenge the way things are done and recommend alternative solutions, a keen awareness of the business and social realities of the global environment in which Kellogg operates, the independence and high performance standards necessary to fulfill the Board's oversight function, and the humility and style to interface openly and constructively with other Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the Director biographies below include a non- exclusive list of other key experiences and qualifications that further qualify the individual to serve on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These collective qualities, skills, experiences and attributes are essential to our Boards ability to exercise its oversight function for Kellogg and its Shareowners, and guide the long-term sustainable, dependable performance of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our amended restated certificate of incorporation and bylaws provide that the Board shall be composed of not less than seven and no more than fifteen Directors divided into three classes as nearly equal in number as possible, and that each Director shall be elected for a term of three years with the term of one class expiring each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board prefers approximately twelve members, but is willing to expand the Board in order to add outstanding candidates or to prepare for departures of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Four Directors have been nominated for re-election at the 2017 Annual Meeting to serve for a term ending at the 2020 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, and the proxies cannot be voted for a greater number of persons than the number of nominees named.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are currently thirteen members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our retirement policy for directors, Mr. Rebolledo is not standing for re-election and will retire from the Board in connection with the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At such time, the size of the Board will be reduced to twelve members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that the Shareowners vote FOR the following nominees: John Bryant, Stephanie Burns, Ph.D., Richard Dreiling and La June Montgomery Tabron.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee was recommended for re-election by the Nominating and Governance Committee for consideration by the Board and proposal to the Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, before the Annual Meeting, any nominee becomes unable to serve, or chooses not to serve, the Board may nominate a substitute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If that happens, the persons named as proxies on the proxy card will vote for the substitute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, the Board may either let the vacancy stay unfilled until an appropriate candidate is identified or reduce the size of the Board to eliminate the unfilled seat.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a balanced Board which individually possesses the leadership and character commensurate with the role of director, and which collectively possesses the mix of skills necessary to provide appropriate oversight of a company the size and complexity of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board possesses a strong mix of experienced and newer directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following skills have been identified by the Board as core competencies:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting and Financial Acumen Branded Consumer Products / Consumer Dynamics Crisis Management Health and Nutrition Innovation / Research and Development International and Emerging Markets People Management Manufacturing and Supply Chain Marketing Regulatory / Government Retail Environment Risk Management Sales and Distribution Social Responsibility Strategy / Strategic Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Directors possess many of these competencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Proxy Statement, the Director biographies highlight five of these competencies that each Director possesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees for Election for a Three-Year Term Expiring at the 2020 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: JOHN BRYANT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bryant, age 51, has been Chairman of the Board of Kellogg Company since July 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2011, he became President and CEO after having served as our Executive Vice President and COO since August 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has been a member of Kellogg Companys Board of Directors since July 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bryant joined Kellogg in March 1998, and was promoted during the next eight years to a number of key financial and executive leadership roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was appointed Executive Vice President and CFO, Kellogg Company, President, Kellogg International in December 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2007, Mr. Bryant was appointed Executive Vice President and CFO, Kellogg Company, President, Kellogg North America and in August
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2008, he was appointed Executive Vice President, COO and CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bryant served as CFO through December 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has also been a trustee of the W. K. Kellogg Foundation Trust since 2015, and is a director of Macy's Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these professional and other experiences, Mr. Bryant possesses particular knowledge and experience in a variety of areas, including accounting and financial acumen, crisis management, strategy and strategic planning, social responsibility, innovation and research and development, branded consumer products and consumer dynamics, health and nutrition, international and emerging markets, and has public company board experience that strengthens the Boards collective knowledge, capabilities and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STEPHANIE BURNS, Ph.D.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Burns, age 62, has served as a Kellogg Director since February 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Burns served as CEO of Dow Corning Corporation from 2004 to 2011 and its Chairman from 2006 through 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She began her career with Dow Corning in 1983 and later became Dow Cornings first director of womens health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Burns was elected to the Dow Corning Board of Directors in 2001 and elected as President in 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Burns is a director of HP Inc. and Corning Incorporated, and within the past five years, Dr. Burns has also served as a director of Dow Corning Corporation and GlaxoSmithKline plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these professional and other experiences, Dr. Burns has been determined to be an "Audit Committee Financial Expert" under the SEC's rules and regulations, possesses particular knowledge and experience in a variety of areas, including accounting and financial acumen, risk management, innovation and research and development, manufacturing and supply chain, regulatory and government affairs, and public company board experience (including specific experience in compensation, corporate relations, manufacturing, and social responsibility oversight) that strengthens the Boards collective knowledge, capabilities and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RICHARD DREILING.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dreiling, age 63, has served as a member of Kellogg Companys Board of Directors since June 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dreiling previously served as Chief Executive Officer of Dollar General Corporation, until his retirement in June 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was also Chairman of Dollar General from December 2008 to January 2016, and served as Senior Advisor from June 2015 to January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dreiling has more than 40 years of diverse retail industry experience in consumer discount, drug store and grocery sectors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He spent 34 years with Safeway, Inc. in roles spanning marketing, manufacturing, distribution, merchandising and retail operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dreiling serves on the boards of Lowes Companies Inc., Aramark and PulteGroup Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee reviewed Mr. Dreiling's professional and other experiences, including his particular knowledge and experience in a variety of areas, including accounting and financial acumen, risk management, strategy and strategic planning, marketing, the retail environment, and public company board experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee considered Mr. Dreiling a candidate for the Board as Mr. Dreiling's knowledge and experience would strengthen the Board's collective knowledge, capabilities and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LA JUNE MONTGOMERY TABRON.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Montgomery Tabron, age 54, has served as a Kellogg Director since February 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Montgomery Tabron was elected President and CEO of the W.K. Kellogg Foundation effective January 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She is also a member of the Board of Trustees of the W.K. Kellogg Foundation since January 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During her 29 years with the W.K. Kellogg Foundation, she held various positions in finance, including Executive Vice President of Operations and Treasurer from March 2012 to December 2013, COO and Treasurer from January 2010 to February 2012, Vice President of Finance and Treasurer from September 2000 to December 2009, Assistant Vice President of Finance and Assistant Treasurer from
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: September 1997 to September 2000, and Controller from May 1987 to September 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Montgomery Tabron has also been a trustee of the W.K. Kellogg Foundation Trust since 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these professional and other experiences, Ms. Montgomery Tabron possesses particular knowledge and experience in a variety of areas, including people management, strategy and strategic planning, social responsibility, health and nutrition, regulatory and government, and private company board experience (including specific experience in social responsibility oversight) that strengthens the Boards collective knowledge, capabilities and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuing Directors to Serve Until the 2019 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARY LASCHINGER.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Laschinger, age 56, has served as a Kellogg Director since October 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She is Chairman of the Board and CEO of Veritiv Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Ms. Laschinger served as Senior Vice President of International Paper Company from 2007 to June 2014, and as President of the xpedx distribution business from January 2010 to June 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also served as President of the Europe, Middle East, Africa and Russia business at International Paper, Vice President and General Manager of International Papers Wood Products and Pulp businesses, as well as in other senior management roles in sales, marketing, manufacturing and supply chain at International Paper.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 DIRECTOR COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only non-employee Directors receive compensation for their services as Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For information about the compensation of Mr. Bryant, refer to Executive Compensation beginning on page 43.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 compensation for non-employee Directors was comprised of annual retainers and equity-based grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual pay is designed to attract and retain diverse, highly-qualified, seasoned, and independent professionals to represent all of our Shareowners, and is targeted against the median of our compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Refer to Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Compensation Approach for a description of the companies that make up our compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee reviews our Director compensation program on an annual basis with Cook & Co., the independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook & Co. provides counsel to the Committee in a variety of ways, including an in-depth study that reports and analyzes the director compensation programs in the compensation peer group to ensure that the program is competitive, consistent with market practice, and designed to attract qualified directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Nominating and Governance Committee conducts this review on an annual basis, it considers adjustments to Director compensation every other year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation is designed to create alignment between our Directors and our Shareowners through the use of equity-based grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, approximately 60% of non-employee Director pay was in equity and approximately 40% was in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation as of December 31, 2016 (end of fiscal year), for non-employee Directors consisted of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Type of Compensation   Value Annual Cash Retainer (paid in quarterly installments)   $100,000 Annual Stock Awards Retainer (issued on May 9, 2016)   $150,000 Annual Cash Retainer for Lead Director / Committee Chair:    Lead Director   $20,000 Audit Committee   $20,000 C&T Committee   $20,000 Nominating and Governance Committee   $20,000 All Other Committees (other than Executive Committee where no retainer is paid)   $10,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual annual pay varies somewhat among non-employee Directors based primarily on committee chair responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent the dollar value of the Annual Stock Awards Retainer exceeds $150,000 at the time of the grant, the excess amount is deducted from the Annual Cash Retainer payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock awards are granted in early May and for non-employee Directors are automatically deferred pursuant to the Kellogg Company Grantor Trust for Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Grantor Trust, shares are available to a Director only upon termination of service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kellogg pays for the business expenses related to Directors attending Kellogg meetings, including room, meals and transportation to and from Board and Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At times, a Director may travel to and from Kellogg meetings on Kellogg corporate aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are also eligible to be reimbursed for attendance at qualified Director education programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director and Officer Liability Insurance and Travel Accident Insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director and officer liability insurance (D&O Insurance) insures our Directors and officers against certain losses that they are legally required to pay as a result of their actions while performing duties on our behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our D&O Insurance policy does not break out the premium for Directors versus officers and, therefore, a dollar amount cannot be assigned for individual Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Travel accident insurance provides benefits to each Director in the event of death or disability (permanent and total)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: during travel on Kellogg corporate aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our travel accident insurance policy also covers employees and others while traveling on Kellogg corporate aircraft and, therefore, a dollar amount cannot be assigned for individual Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elective Deferral Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Deferred Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors, non-employee Directors may each year irrevocably elect to defer all or a portion of their Board annual cash retainer payable for the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount deferred is credited to an account in the form of units equivalent to the fair market value of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board declares dividends, a fractional unit representing the dividend is credited to the account of each participating Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participants account balance is paid in stock upon termination of service as a Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The balance is paid in a lump sum or in up to ten annual installments at the election of the Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of annual installments, dividend equivalents are earned and credited to the participants unpaid balance on the date earned until the account is distributed in full.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum Stock Ownership Requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-employee Directors are expected to comply with stock ownership guidelines, under which they are expected to hold at least five times the annual cash retainer ($500,000  five times the $100,000 cash retainer) in stock or stock equivalents, subject to a five-year phase-in period for newly-elected Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all of the non-employee Directors exceeded or were on track to meet this requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bryant is expected to comply with the stock ownership guidelines described in Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Compensation Policies  Executive Stock Ownership Guidelines, which is at least six times annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bryant exceeds his stock ownership guideline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discontinued Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to December 1995, we had a Directors Charitable Award Program pursuant to which Kellogg would contribute an aggregate of $1 million upon the death of a Director to organizations of the Directors choice (up to four).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 1995, the Board discontinued this program for Directors first elected after December 1995.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Mr. Gordon Gund and Ms. McLaughlin Korologos continued to be eligible to participate in this program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We funded the cost of this program for the two eligible Directors through the purchase of insurance policies prior to 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will make cash payments in the future under this program if insurance proceeds are not available at the time of the Directors death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we recognized nonpension postretirement benefits expense associated with this obligation as follows: Mr. Gordon Gund - $20,721 and Ms. McLaughlin Korologos - $20,082.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Performance Summary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Company delivered strong operating profit growth and cash flow, exceeding the financial targets for those metrics for the Annual Incentive Plan ("AIP") and was below the AIP financial target for net sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we continued to make progress against our 2020 Growth Plan and 2016 priorities by collectively gaining share in our Core 6 cereal brands in the U.S., steadily improving our sales performance in U.S. Snacks, and renovating food and packaging in Frozen Foods and Kashi.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to expand Pringles globally, grew in emerging markets, and added scale in these markets through acquisitions and joint ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also delivered - and expanded on - our productivity initiatives, including Project K, zero-based budgeting and the launching of revenue growth management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resulted in sequential net sales improvement, gross margin expansion in the fourth quarter, and better-than-expected operating profit, earnings per share, and cash flow for the full year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This discussion and analysis provides information regarding the compensation program in place for our CEO, CFO, and the three other most highly-compensated executive officers as of the end of fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this proxy statement, we refer to our CEO, CFO, and the other three individuals as our named executive officers or NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to present Kelloggs executive compensation program in a simple and understandable manner, the Compensation Discussion and Analysis ("CD&A") has been organized into the following sections:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I. Executive Summary  an overview of our compensation program and 2016 results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core Principles  the fundamental tenets upon which our compensation program is built, such as "pay for performance".
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Approach  the process used to develop plan design, set compensation, and verify that actual pay is consisten with our Core Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IV.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Plans and Design  the specific elements of the compensation program and 2016 pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: V. Compensation Policies  key policies that govern the operation of the plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is important to read this section in conjunction with the detailed tables and narrative descriptions under Executive Compensation beginning on page 43 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I.    Executive Summary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This executive summary highlights core principles of our compensation program and the approach followed by the C&T Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We operate in a robust and challenging industry, where competitive compensation is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program for our NEOs should be designed to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide a competitive level of total compensation necessary to attract and retain talented and experienced executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: appropriately motivate our NEOs to contribute to our near- and long-term success; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: help drive long-term total return for our Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Core Principles that underpin our executive compensation program include Pay for Performance, Shareowner Alignment, Values-Based and Mitigating Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A detailed description of these principles is included in the CD&A, and the following is a brief overview of each.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is designed to have a significant portion of an NEOs actual compensation linked to Kelloggs actual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this by utilizing performance-based pay programs like our annual incentive plan, stock option plan and three-year executive performance plan, and by limiting perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We align the interest of our NEOs with Shareowners by encouraging our NEOs to have a meaningful personal financial stake in Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We gain this alignment by maintaining stock ownership guidelines, having a significant portion of an NEOs target compensation stock-based, and using compensation plan goals that are tied to key financial metrics of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our C&T Committee reviews total shareowner return as a key financial metric when reviewing performance to verify our pay for performance connection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Values-Based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are evaluated on the behaviors they exhibit as they drive results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program links the what each NEO contributes as well as how an NEO makes those contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigating Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is designed to mitigate risks relating to our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program accomplishes this by balancing short-term and rolling three-year incentives, which uses various financial metrics to ensure the business grows in a balanced manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we use clawback provisions to mitigate risk by creating appropriate remedies under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approach utilized by the C&T Committee is a key feature that ensures that actual compensation and plan design are consistent with the Core Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation approach is a multi-step process based on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) independent decision-making,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) utilizing compensation peer group data to appropriately target compensation levels,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) benchmarking compensation at the 50th percentile of the compensation peer group,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) following a consistent, rigorous target setting process, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) utilizing verification tools to ensure appropriate decisions are being made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recently, the C&T Committee took the following actions (a more detailed discussion of each of these topics is in the CD&A):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance / Payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for performance is one of the core principles that underpin our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we continued to make progress against our 2020 Growth Plan and 2016 priorities by collectively gaining share in our Core 6 cereal brands in the U.S., steadily improving our sales performance in U.S. Snacks, and renovating food and packaging in Frozen Foods and Kashi.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to expand Pringles globally, grew in emerging markets, and added scale in these markets through acquisitions and joint ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also delivered - and expanded on - our productivity initiatives, including Project K, zero- based budgeting and the launching of revenue growth management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resulted in sequential net sales improvement, gross margin expansion in the fourth quarter, and better-than-expected operating profit, earnings per share, and cash flow for the full year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this performance, awards for the 2016 Annual Incentive Plan ("AIP") and 2014-2016 Executive Performance Plan ("EPP") are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AIP Payouts (Pay for Performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout factor for the 2016 AIP is a second quartile payout of 110% of target, which is the formulaic result from the targets established at the beginning of the year for certain financial and non- financial metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee concluded that a payout of 110% of target was appropriate for the Company's performance for 2016 after considering actual performance compared to the financial targets, the Company's performance versus the performance peer group, total shareowner return, alignment between estimated quartile performance and quartile payout, and key business activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual payouts for each NEO are described later in this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014-2016 EPP Payouts (Pay for Performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that a fourth quartile payout of 35% of the 2014-2016 EPP target would be made to our NEOs for the 2014-2016 performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee concluded that a payout of 35% of target was appropriate for the Company's performance for the three-year period after considering the financial performance against EPP targets, as well as a variety of additional factors, including the Company's total shareowner return, payouts of similar programs for our compensation peer group, and key Company activities during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program Updates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and Company regularly engages with a variety of stakeholders to gain feedback and input on its compensation programs, including discussions with Shareowners and on-going reviews with Cook & Co., the Committee's ndependent consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this input and Committee deliberation, the following program updates were made to the Company's executive compensation program in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016-2018 EPP Metrics (Shareowner Alignment).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016-2018 EPP metrics are currency-neutral comparable operating profit growth and relative total shareowner return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, the EPP metrics had
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: been cumulative cash flow and relative total shareowner return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016-2018 EPP, the metric of relative total shareowner return, which ties directly to the creation of Shareowner value, was maintained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The second metric was changed to currency-neutral comparable operating profit to align with the Company's overall goal of delivering profitable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Benefits (Compensation Approach).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the C&T Committee modified the Kellogg Company Severance Benefit Plan to harmonize benefits across all senior executives, which reduced severance benefits for four of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
