sentences.text: The cash portion of severance benefits for the NEOs is now equal to two times base salary as the C&T Committee eliminated the cash payout of two times target AIP from the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, see "Potential Post-Employment Payments - Severance Benefits."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is based on the following core principles  each of which is more fully described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Alignment,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Values-Based, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigating Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fundamental principle underlying our compensation programs is pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That is, linking the amount of actual pay to the performance of Kellogg and each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this in several ways, including ensuring that target pay levels are market based, utilizing performance-based pay, and limiting perquisites (each of which is more fully described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our 2016 AIP, the formulaic result of the Companys 2016 performance is a second quartile payout of 110% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed the Company's performance versus the currency-neutral comparable operating profit target established in 2016 for purposes of Section 162(m) and determined that the target had been reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exercising its judgment-based methodology to ensure pay is consistent with the Company's performance, the C&T Committee considered a number of factors, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) actual performance that exceeded the 2016 AIP financial targets for operating profit and cash flow and below the financial target for net sales;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Company's performance versus the performance peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) total shareowner return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) alignment between estimated quartile performance and quartile payout; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) key business activities, such as execution against the Company's 2020 Growth Plan, including the acquisition of Ritmo Investimentos in Brazil; continued execution against Project K, the Company's efficiency and effectiveness program; the expansion of zero-based budgeting; and the acceleration of operating margin expansion targets to increase by 350 basis points from 2015 to 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs received a second quartile payout of 110% of target, before consideration for individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information about the AIP, see "Annual Incentives" beginning on page 33 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 EPP, the C&T Committee determined that a fourth quartile payout of 35% of the 2014-2016 EPP target was appropriate based on the Company's performance during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this period, Kelloggs currency-neutral comparable net sales grew at a rate of 0.1% and currency-neutral comparable operating profit grew at a rate of 0.1%, which if unadjusted, would have resulted in a payout of up to 50% of the 2014-2016 EPP target share amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee then considered the following additional factors regarding company performance during the performance period in determining the payout amount:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the total shareowner return for Kellogg of 31.5% from 2014 to 2016, placing Kellogg in the third quartile of our performance peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) payouts for similar programs for our compensation peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the refresh of the Company's strategy in 2015 through the 2020 Growth Plan with tangible and challenging goals;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the execution of Project K, Kelloggs efficiency and effectiveness program announced in November 2013;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) the launch of zero-based budgeting in North America and international regions to strengthen future earnings visibility; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) the launch of a plan to accelerate operating margins by 350 basis points from 2015 to 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee used a judgment-based methodology in exercising its discretion to set the actual 2014-2016 EPP payout at 35% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market Driven Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All components of our executive compensation package are targeted at the 50th percentile of our compensation peer group to ensure that our executives are appropriately compensated, and we are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: able to recruit and retain the right talent for the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation opportunities may be positioned above or below the 50th percentile of our compensation peer group based on time in position, criticality of retention, and sustained performance, as well as other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual incentive compensation payouts may be above or below the 50th percentile of our compensation peer group based on performance against pre-determined goals that are designed to drive sustainable results and increase Shareowner value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of our NEOs target compensation is performance-based pay tied to both short-term performance (AIP awards) and long-term performance (EPP awards and stock options).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our CEO, 89% of 2016 target compensation (salary, annual incentives and long-term incentives) was comprised of performance-based incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart above highlights the percentage contribution of each element of 2016 target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart demonstrates how base salary (fixed component) contributes less for the CEO from a percentage standpoint than the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited Perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further ensure pay for performance, executives receive limited perquisites, as shown on page 39.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information about perquisites, refer to Executive Compensation  Summary Compensation Table  footnote e.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aligning the interests of our executives with Shareowners is an important way to drive behaviors that will generate long-term Shareowner value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We align these interests by using equity awards that have a long-term focus and by maintaining robust stock ownership guidelines (each of which is more fully described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-based incentives are an effective method of facilitating stock ownership and further aligning the interests of executives with those of our Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, a significant portion of our NEOs total target compensation is comprised of equity-based incentives (70% for the CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, our Shareowners expressed strong support for the Company's compensation program with approximately 98% of votes cast in favor of Kelloggs Say-on-Pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: addition, during the course of 2016, the Company continued its practice of engaging with our Shareowners about various corporate governance topics, including executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When setting compensation, and in determining compensation policies and practices like changing long-term incentives mix and the performance metrics, the C&T Committee took into account feedback from Shareowners received through the Companys Shareowner outreach program, as well as the strong results of the 2016 Shareowner advisory resolution to approve executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Longer-Term Focus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our EPP is a stock-based, pay for performance, multi-year incentive plan intended to focus senior management on achieving critical goals over three-year periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 EPP, these goals were tied to currency-neutral comparable net sales growth and currency-neutral comparable operating profit growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2015-2017 EPP, the metrics are cash flow and relative total shareowner return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016-2018 EPP, the metrics are currency-neutral comparable operating profit growth and relative total shareowner return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, stock options granted in 2016 vest in three equal annual installments in 2017, 2018, and 2019 and are exercisable until the 10th anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kellogg has established robust share ownership guidelines to strengthen the ongoing and continued link between the interests of NEOs and Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman and CEO is expected to own shares equal to at least six times his annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other NEOs are expected to own shares equal to at least three times their annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a holding period which requires that all of our NEOs hold all shares received from option or stock awards (including EPP awards) until their respective ownership guideline is met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs currently exceed or are on track to meet their ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Values-Based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kelloggs compensation program is designed to reward an executives performance and contribution to Kelloggs objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs are evaluated on their specific contributions, as well as the behaviors they exhibit as they drive results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In other words, our compensation is linked to what each NEO contributes as well as how an NEO makes those contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shared behaviors (what we call our K Values) that Kellogg expects from its NEOs and believes are essential to achieving long-term dependable and sustainable growth and increased value for Shareowners are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: acting with integrity and showing respect;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: being accountable for our actions and results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: being passionate about our business, our brands and our food;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: having the humility and hunger to learn;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: striving for simplicity; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: loving success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigating Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program is designed so that it does not encourage taking unreasonable risks relating to our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kelloggs compensation program mitigates risk by balancing short-term and rolling multi-year incentives which use various financial metrics to encourage the business to grow in a balanced manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the use of clawback provisions further drives risk mitigation by creating appropriate remedies under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the C&T Committee reviewed our compensation program to identify design features considered to encourage excessive risk taking and Kelloggs approach to those features.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this review, and together with input from the independent compensation consultant, the C&T Committee determined that the risks arising from Kelloggs compensation policies and practices fo our employees are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain clawback provisions in each of our AIP, stock options, and EPP programs which give the Company the ability to recover (clawback) previously granted payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The provisions allow Kellogg to recoup performance-based gains by executive officers (and other program participants) for fraud or misconduct causing a financial restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation approach is based on (1) independent decision making, (2) utilizing compensation peer group data to appropriately target compensation levels, (3) targeting benchmarking compensation at the 50th percentile of the compensation peer group, (4) following a consistent, rigorous target setting process, and (5) utilizing verification tools to ensure appropriate decisions are being made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each is described more fully below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our C&T Committee is responsible for administering the compensation program for executive officers of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Committee are fully independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the Committee members are current or former employees of Kellogg, and they are not eligible to participate in any of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, see Board and Committee Membership  Compensation and Talent Management Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee has utilized an independent compensation consultant for many years, and engaged Cook & Co. as its independent compensation consultant for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook & Co. works directly for the C&T Committee, and, pursuant to Company policy, is prohibited from providing any consulting or other services to Kellogg or our executive officers other than the work performed on behalf of the Committee or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has considered the independence of Cook & Co. in light of SEC rules and NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with this process, the Committee has reviewed, among other items, a letter from Cook & Co. addressing the independence of Cook & Co. and the members of the consulting team serving the Committee, including the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) services provided to Kellogg by Cook & Co.,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) fees paid by Kellogg as a percentage of Cook & Co.s total revenue,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) policies or procedures of Cook & Co. that are designed to prevent conflicts of interest,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) any business or personal relationships between the senior advisor of the consulting team with a member of the Committee,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) any Company stock owned by the senior advisor or any member of his immediate family, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) any business or personal relationships between our executive officers and the senior advisor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee discussed these considerations and concluded that the work performed by Cook & Co. and its senior advisor involved in the engagement did not raise any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We benchmark ourselves against comparable companies (our compensation peer group) to ensure that our executive officer compensation is competitive in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee uses peer group data to benchmark our compensation with respect to base salary, target annual and long-term incentives and total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016 compensation decisions, our compensation peer group was comprised of the following branded consumer products companies:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Campbell Soup Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Clorox Company The Coca-Cola Company Colgate-Palmolive Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ConAgra Brands, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Pepper Snapple Group, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Estee Lauder Cos.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: , Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General Mills, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Hershey Company Hormel Foods Corporation The J.M. Smucker Company Keurig Green Mountain, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kimberly-Clark Corporation The Kraft Heinz Company Mattel, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mondelz International, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: McDonalds Corporation NIKE, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PepsiCo, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whirlpool Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yum! Brands, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee periodically reviews the compensation peer group to confirm that it continues to be an appropriate benchmark for our program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determines the compensation peer group, taking into account input from the independent compensation consultant whose viewpoints are based on objective screening criteria for a variety of factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers a variety of criteria to determine our compensation peer group, including companies that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) are in the same or similar lines of business,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) compete for the same customers with similar products and services,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) have comparable financial characteristics that investors view similarly,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) consider Kellogg a peer,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) proxy advisory firms consider Kelloggs peers, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) are within a reasonable range in terms of percentile rank of Kellogg for key financial metrics such as revenue, pre-tax income, total assets, total equity, total employees, market capitalization, and composite percentile rank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our compensation peer group is representative of the market in which we compete for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The size of the group has been established so as to provide sufficient benchmarking data across the range of senior positions in Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation peer group companies were chosen because of their leadership positions in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: branded consumer products and their overall relevance to Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The quality of these organizations has allowed Kellogg to maintain a high level of continuity in the compensation peer group, providing a consistent measure for benchmarking compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The composition of our compensation peer group has changed over time based on market events such as mergers and other business combinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50th Percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All components of our executive compensation package are targeted at the 50th percentile of our compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe targeting the 50th percentile allows Kellogg to recruit the best talent for the organization, while providing a good balance between paying for performance and controlling our compensation expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual incentive compensation payouts will depend largely upon Kelloggs performance versus our operating plan budgets and in part upon our performance peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Again, the design drives pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 performance peer group consists of food companies in the broader compensation peer group (Campbell Soup Co., ConAgra Foods, Inc., General Mills, Inc., The Hershey Co., The J.M. Smucker Co., The Kraft Heinz Company, Mondelz International, Inc. and PepsiCo Inc.), plus McCormick & Co., Nestl S.A. and Unilever N.V. The performance peer companies were chosen because they most closely compete with Kellogg in the consumer marketplace and for investors dollars, and face similar business dynamics and challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the C&T Committee follows a consistent, rigorous process to determine compensation for the NEOs and other senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following process occurs during several meetings over several months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent compensation consultant presents the Committee with relevant compensation information such as a market assessment, compensation peer group benchmarking data, information about other relevant market practices, and emerging trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent consultant makes recommendations to the Committee regarding target levels for total compensation and each pay element for the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO makes recommendations to the Committee regarding the performance and compensation for each NEO (other than himself).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews the information provided by the independent compensation consultant and the compensation recommendations at regular meetings and in Executive Session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review of performance versus our operating plan, performance against the performance peer group, individual performance, input from the independent compensation consultant and other factors, the Committee makes recommendations to the independent members of the Board regarding the compensation for the CEO and the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent members of the Board determine the compensation of the CEO and the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Verification Tools.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee utilizes several tools to help verify that the design of our program is consistent with our Core Principles and that the amount of compensation is within appropriate competitive parameters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, each year, the Committee reviews pay tallies, which includes a detailed analysis of each NEOs target and actual annual cash compensation, equity awards, retirement benefits, perquisites, change-in-control and severance payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews wealth accumulation, which includes the projected value of each NEOs equity awards and retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This analysis describes the amount of compensation each NEO has accumulated to date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with this review, no unintended consequences or other concerns of the compensation program design were discovered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee concluded that the total compensation of the NEOs aligns pay with performance and is appropriate and reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Committee uses a key financial metric, total shareowner return, as a tool to verify our pay for performance connection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: IV.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Plans and Design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO compensation includes a combination of annual cash and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash compensation for NEOs is comprised of base salary and the AIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives consist of stock option grants and three-year EPP awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target for total compensation and each element of total compensation is the 50th percentile of our compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the compensation for each NEO, the C&T Committee considers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individual performance, experience in the role and contributions to achieving our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We apply the same Core Principles and Compensation Approach in determining the compensation for all of our NEOs, including the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also exercises appropriate business judgment in how it applies the standard approaches to the facts and circumstances associated with each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time we set compensation, actual compensation percentiles for the preceding fiscal year are not available, so we are unable to compare actual to target compensation on a percentile basis for our NEOs because of timing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies in our compensation peer group do not all report actual compensation on the same twelve month basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if this information were available, we do not believe it would provide Shareowners with a fair understanding of our executive compensation program because actual compensation can be impacted by a variety of factors, including changes in stock prices, company performance and vesting of retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key elements of our 2016 NEO compensation program are as follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Element Performance / Vesting Period (yrs.) Purpose Characteristics           Fixed Base Salaries  Compensates executives for their level of responsibility and sustained individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, helps attract and retain strong talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed component; evaluated annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans Long-Term Provides an appropriate level of replacement income upon retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, provides an incentive for a long-term career with Kellogg, which is a key objective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed component; however, contributions tied to pay vary based on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance - Based Annual Incentives (AIP) 1 Promotes achieving our annual corporate and business unit financial goals, as well as people safety, food safety and diversity and inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based cash opportunity; amount varies based on company and business results, and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives (EPP and Options) 3 Promotes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) achieving our long- term corporate financial goals through the EPP and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) stock price appreciation through stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based equity opportunity; amounts earned/realized will vary from the targeted grant-date fair value based on actual financial and stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Post-Termination Compensation  Facilitates attracting and retaining high caliber executives in a competitive labor market in which formal severance plans are common.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contingent component; only payable if the executives employment is terminated under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries for NEOs are targeted at the 50th percentile of the compensation peer group, and are set based on an NEOs experience, proficiency, and sustained performance in role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee judged each NEOs base salary for 2016 to be appropriately positioned relative to the 50th percentile based on this analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the C&T Committee evaluates whether to award base salary merit increases, including considering changes in an NEOs role and/or responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the NEOs received base salary merit increases that in the Committees view correctly positioned each NEOs salary relative to the 50th percentile based on sustained performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentive awards to the NEOs are paid under the terms of the Kellogg Annual Incentive Plan ("AIP"), which was approved by the Shareowners and is administered by the C&T Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted to NEOs under the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: terms of the AIP are intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the targets for purposes of Section 162(m) are reached, as was the case for fiscal 2016, the Committee uses a judgment-based methodology in exercising its discretion from the maximum payout level permitted under Section 162(m) to determine the actual payout for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its AIP methodology, at the beginning of fiscal 2016, the Committee established annual incentive opportunities for each NEO as a percentage of the executives base salary (AIP Target).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP Targets for each NEO are benchmarked against the 50th percentile of the compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Committee sets performance ranges (which we refer to as bandwidths) centered on performance targets for currency-neutral comparable operating profit, currency-neutral comparable net sales, and cash flow to help determine what percentage of the AIP Target would be paid out to each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targets and bandwidths are based on our operating plan for the fiscal year and are designed to achieve our business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Targets are then compared with the forecasted performance of the performance peer group to ensure that our operating plan targets are reasonable and challenging relative to the forecasted performance for the performance peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating plan targets generally fall within the median range of forecasted performance for the performance peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual percent of the AIP Target paid to our NEOs each year can range from 0% to 200% of the target opportunity, based primarily upon performance against currency-neutral comparable operating profit, currency-neutral comparable net sales, cash flow, safety and diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the 0% to 200% bandwidth for the AIP payout relative to AIP Target, each performance metric similarly can have an impact above or below the 100% target depending on performance against that metric, with the actual AIP payout capped at 200% of AIP Target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee and management believe that by using the financial metrics of operating profit, net sales, and cash flow, Kellogg is encouraging profitable growth and cash generation for Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and management further believe that the financial metrics should measure comparable operating performance, as such measures provide a clearer view into the Company's underlying performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the AIP financial measures for operating profit ("AIP Operating Profit") and net sales ("AIP Net Sales") exclude the impact of foreign currency translation, mark-to-market adjustments, acquisitions, dispositions, transaction and integration costs associated with the acquisitions and investments in joint ventures, costs related to Project K, differences in shipping days, and the performance of the Company's Venezuelan business given the highly inflationary environment in Venezuela.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AIP Operating Profit and AIP Net Sales also reflect certain budgeted assumptions relating to integration costs and shipping day differences in our operating plan to facilitate year-to-year comparisons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the budgeted assumptions, performance reported in our financial statements may differ from performance against our AIP performance targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP financial measure for cash flow ("AIP Cash Flow") uses operating cash flow reduced by an amount equal to Kelloggs capital expenditures and, consistent with the 2016 AIP design, excluded cash outlays from a bond tender.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AIP Operating Profit, AIP Net Sales and AIP Cash Flow are non-GAAP measures which will differ from, for example, the GAAP measures of operating profit or net sales growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to operating results, each NEO is held accountable for achieving annual goals set at the start of the fiscal year relating to current organizational capabilities and future organizational requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our commitment to a balanced approach between individual performance and adherence to our Core Principles, the NEOs are assessed both against their level of individual achievement against these agreed upon goals and the alignment of their behavior in achieving those goals with our core values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to this as balancing the what and the how of individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 AIP Payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout factor for the 2016 AIP is 110% of target, which is the formulaic result of the Company's performance against the targets established at the beginning of the year for operating profit, net sales and cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our NEOs, 90% of their target opportunity consisted of AIP Operating Profit, AIP Net Sales and AIP Cash Flow performance and are weighted 50%, 30% and 20%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: People safety, food safety and quality, and diversity and inclusion comprise the remaining 10% of target opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we continued to make progress against our 2020 Growth Plan and 2016 priorities by collectively gaining share in our Core 6 cereal brands in the U.S., steadily improving our sales performance in U.S. Snacks, and renovating food and packaging in Frozen Foods and Kashi.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to expand Pringles globally, grew in emerging markets, and added scale in these markets through acquisitions and joint ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also delivered - and expanded on - our productivity initiatives, including Project K, zero- based budgeting and the launching of revenue
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: growth management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resulted in sequential net sales improvement, gross margin expansion in the fourth quarter, and better-than- expected operating profit, earnings per share, and cash flow for the full year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards for the 2016 AIP are reflective of that performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance target for AIP Operating Profit was growth of 5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full-year performance exceeded the target and grew 6.7%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance target for AIP Net Sales was 0.8% growth, while full-year actual performance was below target with a 1.1% decline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance target for AIP Cash Flow was $1.1 billion which, consistent with plan design, took into account an approximately $150 million cash flow impact from the execution of Project K and excluded the after-tax cash cost of a bond tender of approximately $97 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Full-year performance exceeded the target with AIP Cash Flow of $1.219 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall, the AIP Operating Profit and AIP Cash Flow were above expectations and AIP Net Sales was below expectations, resulting in an AIP payout factor for the financial metrics of 112% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the non-financial metrics, objective and challenging performance targets were set at the beginning of the fiscal year for:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Food safety and quality measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company was above target, and better than 2015 actual results for the food safety and quality measures, with strong performance in quality and food safety audits and a reduction in consumer complaints.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity and inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company continues its focus on diversity and inclusion as an important enabler to its business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Company was above target on hiring and turnover, but below target on promotions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: People safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company was below target on its challenging people safety metrics, but performed better than 2015 actual results in total recordable incidents and loss time incidents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP payout factor for the non-financial metrics was 90% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The formulaic result of Kelloggs performance against its financial and non-financial metrics is a payout factor of 110% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In exercising its judgment-based methodology to ensure appropriate pay for the Companys performance, the C&T Committee considered a number of factors, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: actual performance against the targets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance versus the performance peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: total shareowner return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: alignment between estimated quartile performance and quartile payout;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: key business activities such as execution against the Company's 2020 Growth Plan, including the acquisition of Ritmo Investimentos in Brazil; continued execution against Project K, the Company's efficiency and effectiveness program; the expansion of zero-based budgeting; and the acceleration of operating margin expansion targets to increase by 350 basis points from 2015 to 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these reasons, the Committee determined that our NEOs should receive the formulaic payout of 110% of target for the 2016 AIP, before consideration for individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee considered Mr. Hood's individual performance in 2016, and awarded him an AIP payout equal to 100% of his AIP Target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered a number of factors in assessing Mr. Hood's individual performance, including performance of our European business and Mr. Hood's positive contribution to a number of initiatives for the European region.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considered Mr. Dissinger's individual performance in 2016 and awarded him an AIP payout equal to 120% of his AIP target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered a number of factors in assessing Mr. Dissinger's individual performance, including his contribution to the continued execution against Project K, the expansion of zero-based
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: budgeting and his leadership role in the planning to expand the Company's operating margin by 350 basis points from 2015 to 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below includes information about the 2016 AIP for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AIP Target     AIP Maximum    2016 AIP Payout (Paid in March 2017)  Name   % of Base  Salary(1)   Amount($)   Amount($)   % of AIP  Target   Amount of AIP Payout ($) John Bryant   165%   2,039,400   4,078,800   110%   2,243,300 Paul Norman   110%   871,100   1,742,200   110%   958,200 Ron Dissinger   100%   720,000   1,440,000   120%   864,000 Chris Hood   90%   497,900   995,800   100%   497,900 Gary Pilnick   95%   684,000   1,368,000   110%   752,400
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) For AIP purposes, incentive opportunities are based on executives salary levels at the last day of the calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual salary increases become effective in April of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term incentives are provided to our executives under the 2013 Long-Term Incentive Plan ("LTIP"), which was approved by our Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These incentives are intended to promote achieving our long-term corporate financial goals and earnings growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTIP allows for grants of stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted shares and units and performance shares and units (such as EPP awards), and is intended to meet the deductibility requirements of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code as performance-based pay (resulting in paid awards being tax deductible to Kellogg).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total amount of long-term incentives for the NEOs (based on the grant date expected value) is targeted at the 50th percentile of the compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the 2016 long-term incentive opportunity for the NEOs was provided through equity-based awards, which the C&T Committee believes best achieves several of the Core Principles, including Pay for Performance and Shareowner Alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee determined that the NEOs would receive approximately 50% of their total long-term incentive opportunity in stock options and the remaining 50% in performance shares (granted under the EPP, as discussed below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee established this mix of awards after considering our Core Principles, compensation peer group practices and cost implications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Performance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EPP is a stock-based, pay for performance, multi-year incentive plan intended to focus senior management on achieving critical multi-year operational goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance under EPP is measured over a three-year performance period based on performance levels set at the start of the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance levels are based on our long-range operating plan, and are intended to be realistic and reasonable, but challenging, in order to drive sustainable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EPP contemplates the use of various metrics, as determined by the C&T Committee from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee periodically changes the metrics as a way to ensure the business focuses on driving long-term value for our Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2011-2013 EPP, 2012-2014 EPP, and 2013-2015 EPP, the payouts were below target, fourth quartile payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout for the 2014-2016 EPP is 35% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 EPP, the metrics were currency- neutral comparable net sales growth and currency-neutral comparable operating profit growth, which were chosen to drive key business goals and increase Shareowner value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currency-neutral comparable net sales and currency-neutral comparable operating profit exclude the impact of foreign currency translation, mark-to-market adjustments, acquisitions, dispositions, transaction and integration costs associated with acquisitions and investments in joint ventures, costs related to Project K, and differences in shipping days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vested EPP awards are paid in Kellogg common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2014-2016 EPP performance period ended on December 31, 2016 (the last day of fiscal 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, after Kelloggs 2016 annual audited financial statements were completed, the C&T Committee reviewed our performance versus the operating profit target established in 2014 for purposes of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that the target set for purposes of Section 162(m) had been
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee then considered other aspects of company performance and used a judgment-based methodology in exercising its discretion to determine the actual payout for the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the period covering fiscal years 2014-2016, Kelloggs currency-neutral comparable net sales increased at a rate of 0.1% and currency-neutral comparable operating profit increased at a rate of 0.1%, which if unadjusted, would have resulted in a payout of up to 50% of the 2014 -2016 EPP target share amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee concluded that a payout of 35% of target was appropriate for the Company's performance during this period after considering the financial performance as well as the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the total shareowner return for Kellogg of 31.5% from 2014 to 2016, placing Kellogg in the third quartile of our performance peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payouts for similar programs for our compensation peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the refresh of the Company's strategy in 2015 through the 2020 Growth Plan with tangible and challenging goals;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the execution of Project K, Kelloggs efficiency and effectiveness program announced in November 2013;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the launch of zero-based budgeting in North America and international regions to strengthen future earnings visibility; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the launch of a plan to accelerate operating margins to 18% by 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2014-2016 EPP awards vested in February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below includes information about 2014-2016 EPP opportunities and actual payouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name   EPP Target Share Amount (#)   EPP Maximum Share Amount (#)   2014-2016 EPP Payout  (Paid in February 2017)   % of EPP Target   Share Amount (#)   Pre-tax Value Realized ($)(1) John Bryant   45,200   90,400   35%   15,820   1,153,278 Paul Norman   8,300   16,600   35%   2,905   211,775 Ron Dissinger   8,200   16,400   35%   2,870   209,223 Chris Hood   3,900   7,800   35%   1,365   99,509 Gary Pilnick   6,400   12,800   35%   2,240   163,296
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) The payout is calculated by multiplying the earned shares by the closing price of our common stock on February 17, 2017, which was $72.90 per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee reviews the EPP metrics annually and receives input on the metrics from Cook & Co. and through the Company's Shareowner outreach program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016-2018 EPP, the metric of relative total shareowner return, which ties directly to the creation of Shareowner value was maintained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The second metric was changed to currency-neutral comparable operating profit to align with the Company's overall goal of delivering profitable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted to NEOs under the terms of the EPP are intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the Committee confirms the performance level delivered is at the level for which the NEOs are eligible to receive a payout under the EPP, the Committee uses a judgment-based methodology in exercising its discretion to determine the actual payout for each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not consider individual performance in determining payouts and instead weighs only Company performance when determining actual payouts under the EPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee also set each individuals EPP target at 50% of his or her total long-term incentive opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the EPP have the opportunity to earn between 0% and 200% of their EPP target,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: however, dividends are not paid on unvested EPP awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016-2018 EPP, the performance target for currency-neutral comparable operating profit growth, excluding Venezuela, is 5% and total shareowner return relative to the relevant peer group at the 50th percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016-2018 EPP cycle began on January 3, 2016 (first day of fiscal 2016) and concludes on December 29, 2018 (last day of fiscal 2018).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016-2018 EPP award opportunities, presented in number of potential shares that can be earned, are included in the Grant of Plan-Based Awards Table on page 47 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee believes stock options align NEOs with Shareowners because the options provide value to the NEO only if our stock price increases after the grants are made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock option awards for our NEOs are determined on a position- by-position basis using proxy and survey data for corresponding positions in our compensation peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual awards may vary from target levels based on the individuals performance, ability to impact financial performance and future potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price for the options is set at the closing trading price on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The minimum vesting period for stock option awards to our NEOs is three years, with one-third of the stock option award vesting each year over the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are exercisable for ten years after grant, which further drives Shareowner alignment by encouraging a focus on long-term growth and stock performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The options granted in 2016 vest and become exercisable in three equal annual installments with one-third vesting on February 19, 2017 (the first anniversary of the grant date), one-third vesting on February 19, 2018 (the second anniversary of the grant date) and the final third vesting on February 19, 2019 (the third anniversary of the grant date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The per-share exercise price for the stock options is $75.52, the closing trading price of Kellogg common stock on the date of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 84% of the stock options covered by the 2016 grant were made to employees other than the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Long-Term Incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock and Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We award restricted stock and restricted stock units from time to time to selected executives and employees based on a variety of factors, including facilitating recruiting and retaining key executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys practice when granting any of these awards to NEOs is to provide a grant approximately equal to one times the employees base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For grants to NEOs, restricted stock awards vest and become unrestricted after a three year post-grant holding period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2013, Kellogg granted performance-based restricted stock units ("PBRSUs") to Mr. Norman, Mr. Dissinger and Mr. Pilnick to enhance the retention of those senior executives who the Committee believed were critical to the overall success of certain key, long-term strategic initiatives (including Project K), as well as to maintaining business continuity and driving growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with past practice, the award value of the PBRSUs granted to these senior executives was approximately equal to one times the base salary of the recipient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards were designed to qualify as performance- based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee certified that the performance condition of exceeding a minimum comparable diluted earnings per share threshold measured on a cumulative basis commencing at the beginning of the fourth quarter of fiscal 2013 and ending at the end of the third quarter of fiscal 2016 had been met and the PBRSUs vested on November 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Termination Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs are covered by arrangements which specify payments in the event the executives employment is terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These severance benefits, which are competitive with the compensation peer group and general industry practices, are payable if and only if the executives employment is terminated without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Kellogg Severance Benefit Plan and the Change of Control Policy have been established primarily to attract and retain talented and experienced executives and further motivate them to contribute to our short- and long-term success for the benefit of our Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kelloggs severance program is consistent with market practices and cash severance for our NEOs is payable in the amount of two times the current annual salary as the C&T Committee recently eliminated the cash payout of two times target AIP from the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash compensation following a change in control for NEOs is payable in the amount of two times the current annual salary plus two times the current target annual incentive award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, please refer to Potential Post-Employment Payments, which begins on page 58 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bryant, Mr. Norman, Mr. Dissinger and Mr. Pilnick are eligible to participate in Kellogg-provided defined benefit pension plans which provide benefits based on years of service and pay (salary plus annual incentive only) to a broad base of eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of an employee's base salary and annual incentive payout are integral components of determining the benefits provided under these plans, and thus, an individual's performance over time will influence the level of his or her retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hood participates in a Kellogg-provided defined contribution plan which provides benefits based on years of service and base salary to salaried employees that joined the Company through the acquisition of Pringles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts earned under long-term incentive programs such as EPP awards, gains from stock options and awards of restricted stock or restricted stock units are not included when determining retirement benefits for any plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we do not pay above-market interest rates on amounts deferred under either our qualified or non- qualified savings and investment plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, please refer to Retirement and Non-Qualified Defined Contribution and Deferred Compensation Plans, which begins on page 53 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides limited perquisites to the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Summary Compensation Table beginning on page 43 of this proxy statement contains itemized disclosure of all perquisites to our NEOs, regardless of amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a tax-qualified employee stock purchase plan that is made available to substantially all U.S. employees, which allows participants to acquire Kellogg stock at a discounted price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the plan is to encourage employees at all levels to purchase stock and become Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan allows participants to buy Kellogg stock at a 5% discount to the market price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under applicable tax law, no plan participant may purchase more than $25,000 in market value, as defined in the plan, of Kellogg stock in any calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: V. Compensation Policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to preserve the linkage between the interests of senior executives and those of Shareowners, senior executives are expected to establish and maintain a significant level of direct stock ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This can be achieved in a variety of ways, including by retaining stock received upon exercise of options or the vesting of stock awards (including EPP awards), participating in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan and purchasing stock in the open market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership requirement for our Chairman and CEO is six times annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership requirement for our other NEOs under our stock ownership guidelines is three times annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current stock ownership guidelines (minimum requirements) are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer 6x annual base salary Named Executive Officers (other than the CEO) 3x annual base salary Other senior executives 2-3x annual base salary depending on level
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These executives have five years from the date they first become subject to a particular level of the guidelines or from the date of a material increase in their base salary to meet them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of complying with our guidelines, stock considered owned includes shares owned outright, shares acquired through the employee stock purchase plan, and 60% of unvested restricted stock and restricted stock units, and excludes unexercised stock options and unvested EPP awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a holding period which requires that all of our NEOs hold all shares received from option or stock awards (including EPP awards) until their respective ownership guideline is met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our NEOs currently meet or are on track to meet their ownership guideline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee reviews compliance with the guidelines on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Practices Regarding the Grant of Equity Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee has generally followed a practice of making all option grants to executive officers on a single date each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the relevant Committee meeting, the Committee reviews an overall stock option pool for all participating employees and recommendations for individual option grants to executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Committee approves the overall pool and the individual option grants to executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board grants these annual awards at its regularly-scheduled meeting in February.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The February meeting usually occurs within a few weeks following our final earnings release for the previous fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that it is appropriate that annual awards be made at a time when material information regarding our performance for the preceding year has been disclosed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not otherwise have any program, plan or practice to time annual option grants to our executives in coordination with the release of material non- public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPP awards are granted at the same time as options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While most of our option awards to NEOs have historically been made pursuant to our annual grant program, the Committee and Board retain the discretion to make additional awards of options or restricted stock to executives at other times for recruiting or retention purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have any program, plan or practice to time off-cycle awards in coordination with the release of material non-public information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All option awards made to our NEOs, or any of our other employees, are made pursuant to our LTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of options under the LTIP is set at the closing trading price on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have any program, plan or practice of awarding options and setting the exercise price based on the stocks price on a date other than the grant date, and we do not have a practice of determining the exercise price of option grants by using average prices (or lowest prices) of our common stock in a period preceding, surrounding or following the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All grants to NEOs are made by the Board itself and not pursuant to delegated authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to authority delegated by the Board and subject to the Committee-approved allocation, awards of options to employees below the executive level are made by our CEO or his delegates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Securities Trading Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our securities trading policy prohibits our Directors, executives and other employees from engaging in any transaction in which they may profit from short-term speculative swings in the value of our securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes short sales (selling borrowed securities which the seller hopes can be purchased at a lower price in the future) or short sales against the box (selling owned, but not delivered securities), put and call options (publicly available rights to sell or buy securities within a certain period of time at a specified price or the like) and hedging transactions, such as zero-cost collars and forward sale contracts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, this policy is designed to ensure compliance with relevant SEC regulations, including insider trading rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain clawback provisions relating to stock options, AIP awards and EPP awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the clawback provisions for stock options, if an executive voluntarily leaves our employment to work for a competitor within one year after any option exercise, then the executive must repay to Kellogg any gains realized from such exercise (but reduced by any tax withholding or tax obligations).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with our stock option grants in 2009, we have expanded the scope of our clawback provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of fraud or misconduct causing a financial restatement, any gains realized from the exercise of stock options are now subject to recoupment depending on the facts and circumstances of the event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, under our AIP and EPP terms and conditions, in the event of fraud or misconduct causing a financial restatement, the AIP or EPP awards for the plan year of the restatement are subject to recoupment depending on the facts and circumstances of the event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Compensation and Other Related Issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code includes potential limitations on the deductibility of compensation in excess of $1 million paid to the Companys CEO and three other most highly compensated executive officers (other than our principal financial officer) serving on the last day of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the regulations issued by the Internal Revenue Service, we believe we have taken the necessary actions to ensure the deductibility of payments under the AIP and with respect to stock options and performance shares granted under our plans, whenever possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to continue to take the necessary actions to maintain the deductibility of compensation resulting from these types of awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contrast, restricted stock and units granted under our plans generally do not qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the vesting of restricted stock and units in some cases will result in a loss of tax deductibility of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we view preserving tax deductibility as an important objective, we believe the primary purpose of our compensation program is to support our strategy and the long-term interests of our Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In specific instances we have and in the future may authorize compensation arrangements that are not fully tax deductible but which promote other important objectives of Kellogg and of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require any executive base salary above $950,000 (after pre-tax deductions for benefits and similar items) to be deferred into deferred stock units under our Executive Deferral Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy ensures that all base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will be deductible under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred amounts are credited to an account in the form of units that are equivalent to the fair market value of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The units are payable in stock upon the executives termination from employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only NEO affected by this policy in 2016 was Mr. Bryant who deferred $184,000 of his salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The C&T Committee also reviews projections of the estimated accounting (pro forma expense) and tax impact of all material elements of the executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, accounting expense is accrued over the requisite service period of the particular pay element (generally equal to the performance period) and Kellogg realizes a tax deduction upon the approval of the payout or payment to the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION AND TALENT MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As detailed in its charter, the C&T Committee oversees our compensation program on behalf of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the performance of its oversight function, the Committee, among other things, reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis set forth in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the review and discussions referred to above, the Committee recommended to the Board that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016 and our proxy statement to be filed in connection with our 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, each of which will be filed with the SEC.

sentences.text: Director and Officer Liability, Travel Accident and Group Personal Excess Insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director and officer liability insurance (D&O Insurance) insures our NEOs against certain losses that they are legally required to pay as a result of their actions while performing duties on our behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Travel accident insurance provides benefits to our NEOs in the event of death or disability (permanent and total) during travel on Kellogg corporate aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Group personal excess insurance insures our NEOs for damages that an NEO is required to pay for personal injury or property damage in excess of damages covered by underlying insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our D&O Insurance, travel accident insurance, and group personal excess insurance cover employees and others in addition to NEOs and do not break out the premium by covered individual or groups of individuals and, therefore, a dollar amount cannot be assigned for individual NEOs.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
