sentences.text: RELATED PERSON TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy For Evaluating Related Person Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a written policy relating to the Nominating and Governance Committees review and approval of transactions with related persons that are required to be disclosed in proxy statements by SEC regulations, which are commonly referred to as Related Person Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A related person is defined under the applicable SEC regulation and includes our Directors, executive officers and 5% or more beneficial owners of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary administers procedures adopted by the Board with respect to related person transactions and the Nominating and Governance Committee reviews and approves all such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At times, it may be advisable to initiate a transaction before the Nominating and Governance Committee has evaluated it or a transaction may begin before discovery of a related persons participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such instances, management consults with the Chair of the Nominating and Governance Committee to determine the appropriate course of action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of a related person transaction requires the affirmative vote of the majority of disinterested Directors on the Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In approving any related person transaction, the Nominating and Governance Committee must determine that the transaction is fair and reasonable to Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee periodically reports on its activities to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The written policy relating to the Nominating and Governance Committees review and approval of related person transactions is available on our website under the Investor Relations tab, at the Corporate Governance link.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Person Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no related person transactions in 2016 that require reporting under the SEC disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2  ADVISORY RESOLUTION TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Shareowners may vote, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, for a resolution to approve the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual Meeting, a majority of Shareowners voted, consistent with the recommendation of Kelloggs Board of Directors, to hold a shareowner advisory vote on a resolution to approve the compensation of Kelloggs named executive officers annually, until the next required vote on the frequency of shareowner votes on the compensation of Kelloggs named executive officers as required pursuant to Section 14(A) of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the annual advisory votes on a resolution to approve executive compensation allow our Shareowners to provide us with their direct input on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in the proxy statement every year, and is consistent with our policy of seeking input from, and engaging in discussions with, our Shareowners on corporate governance matters and our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This executive summary highlights core principles of our compensation program and the approach followed by the Compensation and Talent Management Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We operate in a robust and challenging industry, where competitive compensation is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program for our NEOs should be designed to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide a competitive level of total compensation necessary to attract and retain talented and experienced executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: appropriately motivate our NEOs to contribute to our near- and long-term success; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: help drive long-term total return for our Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Core Principles that underpin our executive compensation program include Pay for Performance, Shareowner Alignment, Values-Based and Mitigating Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A detailed description of these principles is included in the CD&A, and the following a brief overview of each.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is designed to have a significant portion of an NEOs actual compensation linked to Kelloggs actual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this by utilizing performance-based pay programs like our annual incentive plan, stock option plan and three-year executive performance plan, and by limiting perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We align the interest of our NEOs with Shareowners by encouraging our NEOs to have a meaningful personal financial stake in Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We gain this alignment by maintaining stock ownership guidelines, having a significant portion of an NEOs target compensation stock-based, and using compensation plan goals that are tied to key financial metrics of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our C&T Committee reviews total shareowner return as a key financial metric when reviewing performance to verify our pay for performance connection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Values-Based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are evaluated on the behaviors they exhibit as they drive results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program links the what each NEO contributes as well as how an NEO makes those contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mitigating Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is designed to mitigate risks relating to our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program accomplishes this by balancing short-term and rolling three-year incentives, which uses various financial metrics to ensure the business grows in a balanced manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we use clawback provisions to mitigate risk by creating appropriate remedies under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approach utilized by the C&T Committee is a key feature that ensures that actual compensation and plan design are consistent with the Core Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation approach is a multi-step process based on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) independent decision-making,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) utilizing compensation peer group data to appropriately target compensation levels,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) benchmarking compensation at the 50th percentile of the compensation peer group,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: following a consistent, rigorous target setting process, and (e) utilizing verification tools to ensure appropriate decisions are being made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overview.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recently, the C&T Committee took the following actions (a more detailed discussion of each of these topics is in the CD&A):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance / Payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for performance is one of the core principles that underpin our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we continued to make progress against our 2020 Growth Plan and 2016 priorities by collectively gaining share in our Core 6 cereal brands in the U.S., steadily improving our sales performance in U.S. Snacks, and renovating food and packaging in Frozen Foods and Kashi.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to expand Pringles globally, grew in emerging markets, and added scale in these markets through acquisitions and joint ventures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also delivered - and expanded on - our productivity initiatives, including Project K, zero- based budgeting and the launching of revenue growth management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resulted in sequential net sales improvement, gross margin expansion in the fourth quarter, and better-than-expected operating profit, earnings per share, and cash flow for the full year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this performance, awards for the 2016 Annual Incentive Plan ("AIP") and 2014-2016 Executive Performance Plan ("EPP") are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AIP Payouts (Pay for Performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout factor for the 2016 AIP is a second quartile payout of 110% of target, which is the formulaic result from the targets established at the beginning of the year for certain financial and non- financial metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee concluded that a payout of 110% of target was appropriate for the Company's performance for 2016 after considering actual performance compared to the financial targets, the Company's performance versus the performance peer group, total shareowner return, alignment between estimated quartile performance and quartile payout, and key business activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual payouts for each NEO are described later in this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014-2016 EPP Payouts (Pay for Performance).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that a fourth quartile payout of 35% of the 2014-2016 EPP target would be made to our NEOs for the 2014-2016 performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee concluded that a payout of 35% of target was appropriate for the Company's performance for the three-year period after considering the financial performance against EPP targets, as well as a variety of additional factors, including the Company's total shareowner return, payouts of similar programs for our compensation peer group, and key Company activities during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program Updates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee and Company regularly engages with a variety of stakeholders to gain feedback and input on its compensation programs, including discussions with Shareowners and on-going reviews with Cook & Co., the Committee's independent consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this input and Committee deliberation, the following program updates were made to the Company's executive compensation program in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016-2018 EPP Metrics (Shareowner Alignment).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016-2018 EPP metrics are currency-neutral comparable operating profit growth and relative total shareowner return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, the EPP metrics had been cumulative cash flow and relative total shareowner return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016-2018 EPP, the metric of relative total shareowner return, which ties directly to the creation of Shareowner value, was maintained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The second metric was changed to currency-neutral comparable operating profit to align with the Company's overall goal of delivering profitable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Benefits (Compensation Approach).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the C&T Committee modified the Kellogg Company Severance Benefit Plan to harmonize benefits across all senior executives, which reduced severance benefits for four of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash portion of severance benefits for the NEOs is now equal to two times base salary as the C&T Committee eliminated the cash payout of two times target AIP from the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, see "Potential Post-Employment Payments - Severance Benefits."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the reasons discussed above, we are asking our Shareowners to indicate their support for our NEO compensation as described in this proxy statement by voting FOR the following resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vote is not intended to address any specific item of compensation, but rather the overall compensation of our NEOs and the philosophy, policies and practices described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that Kellogg Companys Shareowners approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the named executive officers, as disclosed in Kellogg Companys Proxy Statement for the 2017 Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of Shareowners pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Summary Compensation Table and the other related tables and disclosure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resolution is advisory, and therefore not binding on Kellogg, the Board or the C&T Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and the Committee value the opinions of Kelloggs Shareowners and, to the extent there is any significant vote against the NEO compensation as disclosed in the proxy statement, we will consider such Shareowners concerns and the Committee will evaluate whether any actions are necessary to address those concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE RESOLUTION APPROVING THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, AS DISCLOSED IN THIS PROXY STATEMENT PURSUANT TO THE COMPENSATION DISCLOSURE RULES OF THE SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3  ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF AN ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC rules enable our Shareowners to indicate how frequently we should seek an advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs, as disclosed pursuant to the SECs compensation disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By voting on this Proposal 3, Shareowners may indicate whether they would prefer an advisory vote on NEO compensation once every one, two, or three years (or you may abstain).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration of this Proposal, our Board of Directors has determined that an advisory vote on executive compensation that occurs every year is the most appropriate alternative for Kellogg at this time, and therefore our Board of Directors recommends that you vote for a one-year interval for the advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In formulating its recommendation, our Board of Directors considered that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation will continue to allow our Shareowners to provide us with their direct input on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in the proxy statement every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is consistent with our policy of seeking input from, and engaging in discussions with, our Shareowners on corporate governance matters and our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We understand that our Shareowners may have different views as to what is the best approach for Kellogg, and we look forward to hearing from our Shareowners on this Proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote on your preferred voting frequency by choosing the option of one year, two years, three years or abstain from voting when you vote in response to the resolution set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the option of once every one year, two years, or three years that receives a majority of all the votes cast for this resolution will be determined to be the preferred frequency with which Kellogg Company is to hold a shareowner vote to approve the compensation of the named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to the Securities and Exchange Commissions compensation disclosure rules (which disclosure shall include the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Summary Compensation Table, and the other related tables and disclosure).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option of one year, two years or three years that receives a majority of all the votes cast by Shareowners will be the frequency for the advisory vote on executive compensation that has been selected by Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that no option receives a majority of the votes cast, we will consider the option that receives the most votes to be the option selected by Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, because this vote is advisory and not binding on the Board or Kellogg in any way, the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of Kelloggs Shareowners and Kellogg to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation more or less frequently that the option selected by the Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE OPTION OF ONE YEAR AS THE FREQUENCY WITH WHICH SHAREOWNERS ARE PROVIDED AN ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION, AS DISCLOSED PURSUANT TO THE COMPENSATION DISCLOSURE RULES OF THE SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4  RATIFICATION OF PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS LLP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP has been appointed by the Audit Committee, which is composed entirely of independent Directors, to be the independent registered public accounting firm for us for fiscal year 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP was our independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP is expected to be present at the annual meeting and to have an opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP representative is also expected to be available to respond to appropriate questions at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Shareowners fail to ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, the Audit Committee would reconsider its appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS LLP AS KELLOGGS INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees Paid to Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of fees billed to Kellogg by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for professional services rendered for the audit of our consolidated financial statements, statutory audits and for reviews of our financial statements included in our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q was approximately $6.6 million in 2016 and $7.5 million in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of fees billed to Kellogg by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for assistance and related services reasonably related to the performance of the audit of our consolidated financial statements and for reviews of our financial statements included in our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q, which were not included in Audit Fees above was approximately $0.3 million in 2016 and $0.8 million in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assistance and related services generally consisted of consultation on the accounting or disclosure treatment of transactions or events and employee benefit plan audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of fees billed to Kellogg by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for professional services rendered for tax compliance, tax advice, and tax planning was approximately $1.5 million in 2016 and $1.3 million in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These tax compliance, tax advice and tax planning services generally consisted of U.S., federal, state, local and international tax planning, compliance and advice, with approximately $0.6 million being for tax compliance in 2016 and approximately $0.5 million being spent for tax compliance in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of all other fees billed to Kellogg by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP for services rendered, and which were not included in Audit Fees, Audit-Related Fees, or Tax Fees above, was $0 in both 2016 and 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preapproval Policies and Procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Charter of the Audit Committee and policies and procedures adopted by the Audit Committee provide that the Audit Committee shall pre-approve all audit, internal control-related and all permitted non-audit engagements and services (including the fees and terms thereof) by the independent registered public accounting firm (and their affiliates) and shall disclose such services in our SEC filings to the extent required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policies and procedures adopted by the Audit Committee, the Audit Committee pre- approves detailed and specifically described categories of services which are expected to be conducted over the subsequent twelve months or a longer specified period, except for the services and engagements which the Chairman has been authorized to pre-approve or approve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Audit Committee has been delegated the authority to pre-approve or approve up to $500,000 of such engagements and services, but shall report such approvals at the next full Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such policies and procedures do not include delegation of the Audit Committees responsibilities to Kellogg management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the services described above for 2016 and 2015 were pre-approved by the Audit Committee and/or the Committee Chairman before PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP was engaged to render the services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees our financial reporting process on behalf of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is composed of six independent directors (as defined by the New York Stock Exchange Listing Standards), met five times in 2016 and operates under a written charter last amended by the Board in February 2015, which is posted on our website at http://investor.kelloggs.com/governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As provided in the Charter, the Committees oversight responsibilities include monitoring the integrity of our financial statements (including reviewing financial information, the systems of internal controls, the audit process, the Enterprise Risk Management process, and the independence and performance of our internal audit function and independent registered public accounting firm) and our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, management has the primary responsibility for the financial statements and the reporting process, including our systems of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities, the Committee reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements to be included in the 2016 Annua Report on Form 10-K with management, including a discussion of the quality and the acceptability of our financial reporting and controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed with the independent registered public accounting firm, PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, who are responsible for expressing an opinion on the conformity of those audited financial statements with generally accepted accounting principles, their judgments as to the quality and acceptability of our financial reporting, internal control and such other matters as are required to be discussed with the Committee under generally accepted auditing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee has discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm the matters required to be discussed by Public Company Accounting Oversight Board Auditing Standard No. 16 - Communications with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm their independence from Kellogg and its management, including matters in the written disclosures and the letter from the independent registered public accounting firm required by Public Company Accounting Oversight Board Rule 3526, Communication with Audit Committees Concerning Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also has considered whether the provision by the independent registered public accounting firm of non-audit professional services is compatible with maintaining their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also discussed with our internal auditors and independent registered public accounting firm the overall scope and plans for their respective audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee meets periodically with the internal auditors and independent registered public accounting firm, with and without management present, to discuss the results of their examinations, their evaluations of our internal controls, and the overall quality of our financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also meets privately with the independent registered public accounting firm, Chief Legal Officer, Corporate Controller and Vice President of Internal Audit at each in-person meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reliance on the reviews and the discussions referred to above, the Committee recommended to the Board that the audited financial statements be included in the Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reappointed our independent registered public accounting firm for our 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rogelio Rebolledo, Chair Stephanie Burns Richard Dreiling Zachary Gund Don Knauss Noel Wallace
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5 - APPROVAL OF THE KELLOGG COMPANY 2017 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 17, 2017, the Board of Directors adopted the Kellogg Company 2017 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the 2017 Plan) subject to approval by the Shareowners at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares reserved for use under Kelloggs current incentive plan, the 2013 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the 2013 Plan), may not be sufficient to fund Kellogg's equity grant needs for 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If approved, the 2017 Plan will replace the 2013 Plan and the 2013 Plan will remain in existence solely for the purpose of addressing the rights of holders of existing awards already granted under the 2013 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kellogg does not anticipate granting any new awards under the 2013 Plan following Shareowner approval of the 2017 Plan and all unused shares available for grant at that time will be included in the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan has no effect on the Kellogg Company 2009 Non-Employee Director Stock Plan, which was approved by Shareowners in 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors unanimously recommends that Shareowners vote FOR the adoption of the 2017 Plan for the following reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Component of Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity and performance-based awards are a core component of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe equity and performance-based awards provide employees, officers and directors with a proprietary interest in maximizing the growth, profitability and overall success of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our long-term incentive compensation program aligns the interests of employees, officers, directors and our long-term Shareowners to create long-term shareowner value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan would increase our ability to achieve this objective by allowing for several different awards, which we believe will help us attract, retain, and motivate employees, officers and directors (or those who will become employees, officers and directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of Share Amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the terms of the 2017 Plan and the amount of the 2017 Plan share reserve, our Board considered the factors above and a number of other factors, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Number of eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on current practices, we currently have approximately 1,700 employees, officers and directors eligible to receive awards under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historical amounts of equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our three-year annual number of shares granted, calculated on our understanding of the methodology utilized by the Proxy Advisory Services division of Institutional Shareholder Services, Inc. (ISS), was approximately 4.9 million shares in 2016, 4.9 million shares in 2015, and 6.4 million shares in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, these amounts are not necessarily indicative of the shares that might be awarded over at least the next three years under the proposed 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See New Plan Benefits below for additional information considered by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historical equity award burn rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our three-year average annual equity grant rate, or burn rate, for the 2014-2016 period, calculated on our understanding of the methodology utilized by ISS, was 1.53%, which was lower than ISSs maximum burn rate guidance of 2.0% for our industry classification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current and projected overhang percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, we had 28.7 million shares of our common stock subject to outstanding equity awards or available for future equity awards under our equity compensation plans, which represented approximately 7.6% of fully diluted common shares outstanding, calculated on our understanding of the methodology utilized by ISS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our estimated 2017 year-to-date equity grant usage, the 16 million new shares proposed to be included in the 2017 Plan share reserve would increase the overhang percentage by an additional 3.7% to approximately 11.3%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anticipated duration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we continue making equity awards consistent with our practices over the past three years as set forth above, we estimate that the shares available for future awards, including the 16 million additional shares if the 2017 Plan is approved, will be sufficient for Plan awards for at least three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner approval of the 2017 Plan is being sought in order to (1) meet the stockholder approval requirements of the New York Stock Exchange, (2) obtain approval of the material terms of the 2017 Plan, including performance criteria and individual award limitations, for purposes of qualifying certain compensation under the 2017 Plan as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (the Code), and (3) qualify certain stock options authorized under the 2017 Plan for treatment as incentive stock options for purposes of Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of the basic features of the 2017 Plan is set forth below including minimum vesting requirements, limits on the accrual of dividends on unearned awards and recoupment of awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The summary is subject to the specific provisions contained in the full text of the 2017 Plan set forth in Appendix A to this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan is consistent in substance with the 2013 Plan, but with several key updates, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adding material breach of code of conduct and willful failure to cooperate with government investigations to definition of "cause";
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adding relocation of principal place of employment must be more than 50 miles to definition of "good reason";
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: eliminating limitation to withhold only up to the minimum required tax rate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increasing the limit for other cash based awards to $10 million;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adding a minimum vesting or performance period of one year for 95% of all awards granted under the plan; an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: specifying that dividends or dividend equivalents can only be paid or accrued on awards that ultimately vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan Term
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan will be effective on February 17, 2017, the date of its adoption by the Board, subject to Shareowner approval at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No new awards may be granted under the 2017 Plan after February 17, 2027.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the term and exercise of awards granted before then may extend beyond that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may terminate the 2017 Plan at any time with respect to all awards that have not been granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Administration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Plan is administered by the Compensation and Talent Management Committee of the Board of Directors (the Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is currently composed of only non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Committee is a Non-Employee Director within the meaning of Rule 16b-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the Exchange Act), an outside director within the meaning of Section 162(m) of the Code and an independent director as defined under Section 303A of the Listed Company Manual of the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the 2017 Plan, the Committee has the authority to select the participants, make awards in such amounts and form as the Committee shall determine, impose restrictions, terms, and conditions upon such awards as the Committee shall deem appropriate and correct any technical defects or omissions in the 2017 Plan or any award agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may designate persons other than members of the Committee to carry out the day-to-day administration of the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee may, in its sole discretion, delegate its authority to one or more senior executive officers of Kellogg for the purpose of making awards to participants who are not subject to Section 16 of the Exchange Act, but no officer of Kellogg may grant awards to himself or herself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees, officers and directors, and those who will become employees, officers or directors of Kellogg and/or its subsidiaries are eligible to receive awards under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under the 2017 Plan will be made by the Committee or by a senior executive officer who has been delegated authority to grant awards to participants who are not subject to Section 16 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No determination has been made as to awards that may be granted under the 2017 Plan, although it is anticipated that recipients of awards will include the current executive officers of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, Kellogg and its subsidiaries have approximately 1,700 employees, officers and directors eligible to participate in the 2017 Plan based on current practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, restricted shares and restricted share units awarded under the 2017 Plan that vest solely as a result of the passage of time and continued service must be subject to a minimum vesting period of three years from the date of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: grant (including pro rata vesting over such period), and restricted shares, restricted share units, performance shares and performance share units awarded under the 2017 Plan whose vesting is subject to the achievement of specified performance goals over a performance period must be subject to a performance period of not less than one year from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acceleration is permitted on death, disability, retirement, a change in control and certain other limited cases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares Authorized; Share Limitations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum number of shares of Kellogg Company common stock for which awards may be granted under the 2017 Plan may not exceed the total of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) 16 million shares; plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the total number of shares remaining available for future grants under the 2013 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total number of shares remaining available for issuance under the 2017 Plan will be reduced by two shares for each share issued pursuant to an award under the 2017 Plan other than a Stock Option or a Stock Appreciation Right, or potentially issuable pursuant to an outstanding award other than a Stock Option or a Stock Appreciation Right, which will in each case reduce the total number of shares remaining by one share for each share issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to adjustment pursuant to the terms of the 2017 Plan, (1) no participant may receive awards of stock options or SARs exceeding 2 million shares in any calendar year; (2) no more than 1 million shares may be paid in any calendar year in respect of performance share units, performance-based restricted shares and performance-based restricted share units to any individual participant; (3) the maximum cash amount payable under any performance unit intended to be performance-based compensation to any participant for any calendar year is $10 million; and (4) the maximum cash amount payable under any other cash-based award intended to be performance-based compensation to any participant for any calendar year is $10 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The limits on the numbers of shares described in this paragraph and the number of shares subject to any award under the 2017 Plan are subject to proportional adjustment, to reflect certain stock changes, such as stock dividends and stock splits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of common stock that, as of the effective date of the 2017 Plan, have not been issued under the 2001 Long-Term Incentive Plan, the 2003 Long-Term Incentive Plan and the 2009 Long-Term Incentive Plan (together, the Old Plans) and are not covered by outstanding awards under the Old Plans shall not be available for Awards under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares will not be added to the maximum share limitations under the 2017 Plan if: the shares would have been issued upon any exercise of an option but for the fact that the exercise price was paid by a net exercise; the shares were already owned by a participant and are tendered (either actually or by attestation) in payment of the exercise price of an option; the shares are withheld by Kellogg to satisfy the tax withholding obligation with respect to an option or SAR; the shares are repurchased on the open market with proceeds of an option exercise; or the shares are covered by an exercised SAR, regardless of whether shares of common stock are actually issued by the exercise, which are considered issued or transferred in accordance with the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The closing price per share of Kellogg Company common stock as reported on the New York Stock Exchange on February 17, 2017 was $72.90.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code generally limits to $1,000,000 the amount that a publicly held corporation is allowed each year to deduct for the compensation paid to its Chief Executive Officer and the three other most highly compensated officers other than the principal financial officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, qualified performance-based compensation is not subject to the $1,000,000 deduction limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under the 2017 Plan are intended to qualify as qualified performance-based compensation, by satisfying the following requirements: (1) the performance goals are determined by the Committee consisting solely of outside directors; (2) the material terms under which the compensation is to be paid, including examples of the performance goals, are approved by a majority of Kellogg Company Shareowners; and (3) if applicable, the Committee certifies that the applicable performance goals and any other material terms were satisfied before payment of any performance-based compensation is made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Committee views preserving tax deductibility as an important objective, it believes the primary purpose of Kelloggs compensation program is to support its strategy and the long-term interests of its Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the Committee may authorize awards under the 2017 Plan that are not fully tax deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All awards are expected to be evidenced by an award agreement between Kellogg and the individual participant and approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the discretion of the Committee, an eligible employee may receive awards from one or more of the categories described below, and more than one award may be granted to an eligible employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Types of awards under the 2017 Plan include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options - The Committee may grant incentive stock options or Non-Qualified Stock Options (collectively referred to as stock options).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An incentive stock option is intended to be an incentive stock option within the meaning of Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Non-Qualified Stock Option is any other stock option granted by the Committee that is not specifically designated as an incentive stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of stock options shall be determined by the Committee, but in no event shall the exercise price be less than 100% of the closing price of Kelloggs common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of each stock option shall be determined by the Committee; provided, however, that the term of stock options shall not exceed 10 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options may be exercised in whole or in part, and the option price may be paid (1) by cash, certified check, bank draft, electronic transfer, or money order payable to the order of Kellogg, (2) if permitted by the Committee in its sole discretion, by surrendering (or attesting to the ownership of) shares of common stock already owned by the participant, (3) pursuant to a net exercise arrangement, or (4) if permitted by the Committee (in its sole discretion) and applicable law, by delivery of, alone or in conjunction with a partial cash or instrument payment some other form of payment acceptable to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special provisions apply to stock options granted to 10% or greater Shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Stock Options granted under the 2017 Plan may contain any reload provisions, entitling the option holder to additional options upon the exercise of existing options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Appreciation Rights - Stock Appreciation Rights (or SARs) represent a right to receive a payment, in cash, shares of Kelloggs common stock, restricted shares (as described below) or a combination thereof, equal to the excess of the fair market value of a specified number of shares of Kellogg common stock on the date the SAR is exercised over the fair market value of such shares on the date the SAR was granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs may be exercised in accordance with the terms established by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of a SAR shall not exceed 10 years from the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Shares and Restricted Share Units - A restricted share is an award of common stock granted to a participant, subject to such restrictions, terms and conditions as the Committee deems appropriate, including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) restrictions on the sale, assignment, transfer, hypothecation or other disposition of such shares,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the requirement that the Participant deposit such shares with Kellogg while such shares are subject to such restrictions, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the requirement that such shares be forfeited upon termination of employment for specified reasons within a specified period of time or for other reasons (including, without limitation, the failure to achieve designated performance goals).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon lapse of the restrictions, restricted shares may be exchanged for unrestricted shares of common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A grant of restricted share units is a notional award of shares of common stock which entitle the participant to a number of unrestricted shares of common stock equal to (or a cash amount equal in value to such number of unrestricted shares of common stock) the number of restricted share units upon the lapse of similar restrictions, terms and conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant holding restricted shares shall have all the rights of a Shareowner of such shares (except as such rights may be limited by the Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restrictions on restricted shares and restricted share units may be performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Units and Performance Share Units and Other Cash-Based Awards - A grant of performance units is a notional award of units (with each unit representing such monetary amount as designated by the Committee) granted to a participant, subject to such terms as the Committee deems appropriate, including the requirement that the participant forfeit such units (or a portion thereof) if certain performance criteria are not met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A grant of performance share units is an award of actual or notional shares of common stock which entitle the participant to a number of shares of common stock equal to the number of performance share units upon achievement of specified performance goals and such other terms and conditions as the Committee deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants receiving a grant of performance units and performance share units will be entitled to payment in respect of such awards if Kellogg and/or the participant achieves certain performance goals during and in respect of a designated performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: setting performance goals for awards intended to qualify as qualified performance-based compensation for Section 162(m) of the Code, the Committee may use such measures as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: net sales;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: improvements in financial ratings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: net income;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: regulatory compliance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: market price per share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: achievement of balance sheet or income statement objectives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: earnings per share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: market or category share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on equity,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: organizational objectives (including diversity, safety and K-values);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on capital employed;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: productivity initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: return on invested capital; cash flow;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: acquisition integration;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discounted cash flow;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: total return to shareowners (including both the market value of Kelloggs stock and dividends thereon);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cumulative cash flow;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: total shareowner return;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: operating profit;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: net earnings growth;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: gross or pre-tax profits;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: sales or revenue growth;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: post-tax profits;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cash flow;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: gross or net margins;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: operating income;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consolidated net income;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: net income per share (basic or diluted);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unit sales volume;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: earnings before or after any one or more of taxes, interest, depreciation and amortization;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: economic value added;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: profitability as measured by return ratios (including return on invested capital, return on assets, return on equity, return on investment and return on sales);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: costs or cost reduction initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: market share;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: production;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: cost reduction goals;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: unit production volume;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: margins (including one or more of gross, operating and net income margins);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: net sales per unit of production
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: sales contribution
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance goals may be absolute or relative and may be expressed in terms of a progression within a specified range.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout of any such award to certain participants may be reduced, but not increased, based on the degree of attainment of other performance criteria or otherwise at the discretion of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A grant of another cash-based award is an award payable in cash to a participant at such time or times and subject to such terms and conditions as determined by the Committee in its sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other cash-based awards may be granted to participants in such amounts, on such terms and conditions, and for such consideration, including no consideration or such minimum consideration as may be required by applicable law, as it shall determine in the Committees sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other cash-based awards may be granted subject to the satisfaction of vesting conditions or may be awarded purely as a bonus and not subject to restrictions or conditions, and if subject to vesting conditions, the Committee may accelerate the vesting of such Awards at any time in its sole discretion, subject to the limitations of the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Plan Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No awards have been granted, and no specific plans have been made for the grant of future awards, under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of any awards under the 2017 Plan will be at the discretion of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, it is not possible to determine the amount or form of any award that will be granted to any individual in the future as there are many variables the Committee considers in granting equity awards, including compensation of the our executive officers compared to peer group compensation, share price at the time the Committee sets executive compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and, for payouts under the our long-term incentive plans, performance against predetermined metrics at the time of settlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in approving the 2017 Plan, the Board did consider a forecast of share utilization for 2017 (which was the only forecasted information available).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share utilization is estimated at 3,515,610 million shares with an estimated grant date fair value of $91.8 million in 2017 compared to 4,065,003 million shares with a grant date fair value of $93.9 million in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These and the forecasts below are based on numerous variables and assumptions that are inherently uncertain and subject to change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, there can be no assurance that these forecasts will be realized and Shareowners are cautioned not to place undue, if any, reliance on such forecasts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although future grants under the 2017 Plan are not determinable at this time, for illustrative purposes and not necessarily indicative of the shares that might be awarded under the 2017 Plan, the table below sets forth the awards that were granted under the 2013 Plan during 2017 to the current named executive officers, all executive officers as a group, all non-executive directors as a group and all non-executive officer employees as a group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below also sets forth the 2017 forecasts for share utilization that were considered by the Board in approving the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Non-Executive Director Group Awards are granted pursuant to the Kellogg Company 2009 Non-Employee Director Stock Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For addition information relating to securities authorized under all of our equity compensation plans as of December 31, 2016, please see the section entitled Equity Compensation Plan Information below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, refer to the section entitled Executive Compensation for information about specific awards granted to our named executive officers during 2016 and any equity awards that remain outstanding as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends and Dividend Equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may provide that awards denominated in stock (other than stock options, SARs and unvested performance share units, performance-based restricted shares and performance-based restricted share units) earn dividends or dividend equivalents; provided that dividends or dividend equivalents shall only be paid or accrued on Performance Shares or other Awards subject to performance-based vesting conditions to the extent that such awards are actually earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the same time that dividends are paid to holders of Kellogg common stock, dividends or dividend equivalents may be paid in cash or shares of common stock or may be credited to an account that the Committee establishes in the name of the participant, to be paid at such time or times as determined by the Committee and as specified in the terms of the applicable award grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may also impose other restrictions on the crediting of dividends or dividend equivalents, such as requiring reinvestment in additional shares or share equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stock dividends paid to Shareowners shall, in respect of restricted shares (or restricted share units, if the Committee grants dividend equivalents in a participants award agreement) shall be treated as additional restricted shares (or restricted share units).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Repricing Prohibited
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as set forth in Section 13 of the 2017 Plan (pertaining to changes in capitalization and other matters), the terms of outstanding awards may not be amended to reduce the exercise price of outstanding stock options or SARs or to cancel outstanding stock options or SARs in exchange for cash, other awards or stock options or SARs with an exercise price that is less than the exercise price of the original stock options or SARs without shareowner approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control or Other Cash-Out
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If there is a Change in Control of Kellogg (as defined in Section 14 of the 2017 Plan) and outstanding awards under the 2017 Plan are not assumed, continued or substituted by the successor to Kellogg, then in order to preserve the participants rights the following shall occur:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) all stock options and SARs become fully vested and exercisable;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) all restrictions on restricted shares shall be deemed lapsed and all restricted share units shall become fully vested and payable; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the performance criteria for all performance units, performance share units, performance-based restricted shares, performance-based restricted share units and other cash-based awards shall be considered earned and payable in full.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee shall have the authority to otherwise require that the holder surrender any stock option and SAR for cancellation by Kellogg, with the holder being entitled to receive a cash payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event outstanding awards are assumed by the successor corporation, such awards shall be subject to the adjustment provisions of Section 13 of the 2017 Plan and shall otherwise continue in effect with all of the terms and conditions of the Plan and the applicable Award Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that a participant holding any such assumed awards is terminated within two years following such Change in Control, such participants outstanding awards will become fully vested, exercisable and payable (as applicable) as of the date of such termination, except as otherwise provided by the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matters relating to the 2017 Plan and its Amendment, Suspension and/or Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Awards may be granted after February 17, 2027.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may suspend or terminate the 2017 Plan (or any portion thereof) at any time, and may amend the 2017 Plan at any time and from time to time in such respects as the Board may deem advisable to ensure that any and all awards conform to or otherwise reflect any change in applicable laws or regulations, or to permit Kellogg or the participants to benefit from any change in applicable laws or regulations or in any other respect the Board may deem to be in the best interests of Kellogg.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, no such amendment, suspension, or termination shall materially adversely affect the rights of any participant and the Board may not make any change that would disqualify the 2017 Plan or any other plan of Kellogg from the benefits provided under Section 422 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No amendment will be made without shareowner approval if required by applicable law or applicable listing requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-transferability of Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted under the 2017 Plan generally will not be transferable, except by will and the laws of descent and distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee may from time to time permit Awards to be transferable to family members (within the meaning of the General Instructions to Form S-8) subject to such terms and conditions as the Committee may impose and applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No award, however, may be transferred for value as defined in the general instructions to Form S-8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Federal Income Tax Consequences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion is intended only as a brief summary of the federal income tax rules relevant to stock options, SARs, performance units, performance share units, restricted shares, restricted share units, other cash-based awards and supplemental cash payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These rules are highly technical and subject to change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion is limited to the federal income tax rules relevant to us and to the individuals who are citizens or residents of the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discussion does not address the state, local, or foreign income tax rules relevant to stock options, stock appreciation rights, performance awards, restricted stock, and supplemental cash payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are urged to consult their personal tax advisors with respect to the federal, state, local, and foreign tax consequences relating to stock options, appreciation rights, performance awards, restricted stock, and supplemental cash payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who is granted an incentive stock option recognizes no income upon grant or exercise of the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the excess of the fair market value of Kellogg shares on the date of exercise over the option exercise price is an item includible in the optionees alternative minimum taxable income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IRS may require the optionee to pay an alternative minimum tax even though the optionee receives no cash upon exercise of the incentive stock option that the optionee can use to pay such tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an optionee holds the common stock acquired upon exercise of the incentive stock option for at least two years from the date of grant and at least one year following exercise (the Statutory Holding Periods), the IRS taxes the optionees gain, if any, upon a subsequent disposition of such common stock, as capital gain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an optionee disposes of common stock acquired through the exercise of an incentive stock option before satisfying the Statutory Holding Periods (a Disqualifying Disposition), the optionee may recognize both compensation income and capital gain in the year of disposition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of the compensation income generally equals the excess of (1) the lesser of the amount realized on disposition or the fair market value of the common stock on the exercise date over (2) the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This income is subject to income (but not employment) tax withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The balance of the gain that the optionee realizes on such a disposition, if any, is long-term or short-term capital gain depending on whether the common stock has been held for more than one year following exercise of the incentive stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special rules apply for determining an optionees tax basis in and holding period for common stock acquired upon the exercise of an incentive stock option if the optionee pays the exercise price of the incentive stock option in whole or in part with previously owned Kellogg shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these rules, the optionee does not recognize any income or loss from delivery of shares of common stock (other than shares previously acquired through the exercise of an incentive stock option and not held for the Statutory Holding Periods) in payment of the exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The optionees tax basis in and holding period for the newly-acquired shares of common stock will be determined as follows: as to a number of newly-acquired shares equal to the previously-owned shares delivered, the optionees tax basis in and holding period for the previously-owned shares will carry over to the newly-acquired shares on a share-for-share basis; as to each remaining newly-acquired share, the optionees basis will be zero (or, if part of the exercise price is paid in cash, the amount of such cash divided by the number of such remaining newly-acquired shares) and the optionees holding period will begin on the date such shares are transferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under regulations, any Disqualifying Disposition is deemed made from shares with the lowest basis first.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any optionee pays the exercise price of an incentive stock option in whole or in part with previously-owned shares that were acquired upon the exercise of an incentive stock option and that have not been held for the Statutory Holding Periods, the optionee will recognize compensation income (but not capital gain) under the rules applicable to Disqualifying Dispositions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not entitled to any deduction with respect to the grant or exercise of an incentive stock option or the optionees subsequent disposition of the shares acquired if the optionee satisfies the Statutory Holding Periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If these holding periods are not satisfied, we are generally entitled to a deduction in the year the optionee disposes of the common stock in an amount equal to the optionees compensation income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Qualified Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who is granted a non-qualified stock option recognizes no income upon grant of the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of exercise, however, the optionee recognizes compensation income equal to the difference between the exercise price and the fair market value of the Kellogg shares received on the date of exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This income is subject to income and employment tax withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are generally entitled to an income tax deduction corresponding to the compensation income that the optionee recognizes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When an optionee disposes of common stock received upon the exercise of a non-statutory stock option, the optionee will recognize capital gain or loss equal to the difference between the sales proceeds received and the optionees basis in the stock sold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will not receive a deduction for any capital gain recognized by the optionee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an optionee pays the exercise price for a non-statutory option entirely in cash, the optionees tax basis in the common stock received equals the stocks fair market value on the exercise date, and the optionees holding period begins on the day after the exercise date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If however, an optionee pays the exercise price of a non-statutory option in whole or in part with previously-owned shares of common stock, then the optionees tax basis in and holding period for the newly-acquired shares will be determined as follows: as to a number of newly-acquired shares equal to the previously-owned shares delivered, the optionees basis in and holding period for the previously-owned shares will
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: carry over to the newly-acquired shares on a share-for-share basis; as to each remaining newly-acquired share, the optionees basis will equal the shares value on the exercise date, and the optionees holding period will begin on the day after the exercise date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who is granted an SAR recognizes no income upon grant of the SAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of exercise, however, the participant recognizes compensation income equal to any cash received and the fair market value of any Kellogg common stock received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This income is subject to income and employment tax withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are generally entitled to an income tax deduction corresponding to the ordinary income that the participant recognizes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted shares are subject to a substantial risk of forfeiture within the meaning of Section 83 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant to whom we grant restricted shares may make an election under Section 83(b) of the Code (a Section 83(b) Election) to have the grant taxed as compensation income at the date of receipt, resulting in the IRS taxing any future appreciation (or depreciation) in the value of the shares of common stock that we grant as capital gain (or loss) upon a subsequent sale of the shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such an election must be made within 30 days of the date that we grant the restricted shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if a participant does not make a Section 83(b) Election, then the grant shall be taxed as compensation income at the full fair market value on the date that the restrictions imposed on the shares expire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the participant makes a Section 83(b) Election, any dividends that we pay on common stock subject to the restrictions constitutes compensation income to the participant and compensation expense to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any compensation income the participant recognizes from a grant of restricted shares is subject to income and employment tax withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are generally entitled to an income tax deduction for any compensation income taxed to the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Units, Performance Share Units and Restricted Share Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant of a performance unit, performance share uni or restricted share unit does not generate taxable income to a participant or an income tax deduction to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any cash and the fair market value of any Kellogg common stock received as payment in respect of a performance unit, performance share unit or restricted share unit will constitute ordinary income to the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participants income is subject to income and employment tax withholding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are generally entitled to an income tax deduction corresponding to the ordinary income that the participant recognizes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of Withholding Taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have the right to withhold or require a participant to remit to us an amount sufficient to satisfy any federal, state, local, or foreign withholding tax requirements on any grant or exercise made under the 2017 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, to the extent permissible under applicable tax, securities, and other laws, the Committee may, in its sole discretion, permit the participant to satisfy a tax withholding requirement by delivering shares of Kellogg common stock that the participant previously owned or directing us to apply shares of common stock to which the participant is entitled as a result of the exercise of an option or the lapse of a period of restriction, to satisfy such requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR APPROVAL OF THE KELLOGG COMPANY 2017 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN.
